specified channel g except to the extent otherwise authorized by law no monitoring of a terminal connected to the cable system shall be permitted by a franchise operator without the written authorization of the person to be monitored  provided that this section does not prohibit maintenance and testing procedures designed to assure compliance with technical standards or to detect unauthorized reception of a signal h all franchise operators shall conduct annual tests of their cable systems at their expense to insure that the system meets all technical guideline standards prescribed by the fcc a franchise operator shall be responsible for ensuring full compliance with such standards i the franchise operator shall provide the city an accurate map showing the location of all facilities erected constructed and maintained by the operator such maps may be on a scale of one inch equals 100 feet such maps are intended to only show locations and not proprietary information as to the technical specifications of the lines updated maps shall be furnished to the city manager or designee on an annual basis j access to cable service shall not be denied to any group of potential residential cable subscribers by a cable operator because of the income of the residents of the local area in which the group resides a cable operator may not decline to extend service to a developed neighborhood where it has already extended its cable lines to an adjacent undeveloped neighborhood that for example is a new model community such an extension shall only be required if there is at least a density of 30 homes per linear mile on a proratable basis  for example nine homes within threetenths of a mile from existing plant this provision shall not require a cable company to extend service to an area already served by another cable operator there further shall be no discrimination among an operators subscribers for basic cable service nothing herein shall be construed to preclude competitive pricing and marketing offers that are not otherwise in violation of local state or federal law k whenever it is necessary to shut off or interrupt service for the making of repairs installations or adjustments the franchise operator shall do so at such times as will cause the least amount of inconvenience to its subscribers unless such interruption is unforeseen and immediately necessary the operator will give reasonable notice thereof to its subscribers the franchise operator shall prorate each subscribers monthly charge for an interruption of services due to a system shutdown not the fault of the subscriber proration will be granted at the request of the subscriber pursuant to section 2737 l the franchise operator shall so operate its system that there will be no interference with television or radio reception owned receiving antennas the franchise operator will investigate any claim of interference to the television reception of nonsubscribers which might be attributable to the system if the interference is determined to be attributable to the system the operator shall make correction promptly m no franchise operator may utilize negative option billing for service channels or programs to obtain fees from subscribers or potential subscribers  31400 subscriber complaint procedure a all franchise operators shall establish procedures for receiving acting upon and resolving subscriber complaints which shall comply at least with all fcc requirements and the provisions of this article b such procedures shall be filed with the city manager or designee who is hereby made the designated city official under fcc requirements to administer the citys internal complaint procedures notice of the complaint procedures shall be furnished by the operator to its subscribers including credit procedures for loss of service the notice shall be given at the time of initial subscription to the system by the subscriber c all franchise operators shall maintain a local telephone with a listed number to receive subscriber complaints by at least an answering service or machine to record complaints on a 24hour basis the franchise operator shall promptly respond to such complaints including those made in writing d the franchise operator shall maintain all written complaints made by subscribers and the action taken by the operator in response such records shall be maintained for a period of three years and shall be made available to the city for inspection e any continuous total outage of a subscribers service not attributable to the subscriber or his or her equipment which lasts at least 24 hours or more shall be credited for the outage pro rata by the franchise operator for the subscribers billing if requested by the subscriber such credit shall be applied to the subscribers next billing statement  31400 applications for franchise a a person applying for a franchise renewal of a franchise or a transfer of a franchise shall complete the forms required and pay any pertinent application fee which shall be set by resolution of the city council b completed applications shall be submitted to the city manager or designee who in turn will schedule the application for the city council at a duly advertised public hearing c the city council shall grant applications by a separate franchise agreement which shall include identifying information from the application insurance requirements effective date of the franchise and such other terms as the city council may require d the terms for a franchise or a renewal of a franchise shall be for ten years e franchise operators shall pay to the city a franchise fee of three percent per calendar year on the operators gross subscriber revenue payment of the franchise fee shall be made by march 31 for the preceding calendar year to the city manager or designee the payment shall be accompanied by a sworn statement of the operators chief financial officer or a certification by an independent certified public accountant that the gross revenues have been correctly tabulated for the franchise untimely payments shall be assessed a late charge of one and onehalf percent per month on the amount due for each month or portion thereof that full payment has not been made the failure to make full payment including any late charges by june 30 shall result in a public hearing on termination of the operators franchise after notice to the operator a duly authorized agent of the city shall have the right power and authority to inspect and audit the operators records to assess the accuracy of the franchise fee paid or owed  31400 editors note of adopted  states this ordinance creates no further vested rights and the city council reserves the full prerogative to review revise amend and update its regulation of cable television franchises whether to comport with amendments to federal law or otherwise at or before the expiration of this ordinance further section 4 of said ordinance states section 2737e is modified to provide for the payment of a franchise fee in the maximum amount permitted by law indemnification and insurance a franchise operators shall indemnify defend and hold harmless the city and its officers employees and agents from all claims damages taxes costs expenses attorneys fees paralegal fees expert witness fees consultant fees litigation expenses and any other liability of any kind arising from in connection with or as a result of the construction installation operation maintenance repair or any other cable tv activity associated with the franchise excepted from this indemnification is any liability of the city specifically and solely related to its own programming on a governmental access channel and to its actions in interrupting a broadcast to utilize its emergency override capability the provisions of this indemnification shall survive the operators franchise for claims arising during the term of the franchise b the franchise operator shall maintain in full force and effect during the life of any franchise public liability insurance and workers compensation insurance in amounts as specified in the franchise agreement  31400 compliance review of franchise a in the event that a present or future franchise operator is in violation of this article its franchise agreement or a preexisting franchise ordinance if applicable such violation shall be handled as follows 1 the city manager or designee shall specify the violation in writing to the franchise operator 2 the operator shall correct the violation promptly or inform the city in writing why it believes no violation exists or presents its justification in writing for the action or practice if after 30 days from the notice of violation by the city the franchise operator has not corrected the violation or the city does not accept the operators reasons for believing there is no violation the matter will be scheduled for public hearing before the city council for the purpose of determining what action if any is to be taken with respect to the franchise 3 the city council may in its sole discretion impose reasonable sanctions or prescribe reasonable remedial plans or take other reasonable action to condition the continued validity of the franchise the city council also may determine in its sole discretion to terminate the franchise for a material violation b the city council may take immediate action at a public hearing if a franchise operator becomes subject to any court order concerning involuntary bankruptcy insolvency or other similar law adversely affecting its credit worthiness  commences a voluntary case under the federal bankruptcy laws or other federal or state insolvency or similar laws adversely affecting its credit worthiness  and has made a false representation as to a material fact to the city in its franchise application or a material misrepresentation in its communications with or payments to the city c a franchise operator shall not be deemed to be in violation of this article its franchise agreement or a preexisting franchise ordinance if applicable where the alleged noncompliance is caused by labor strikes power outages acts of god or other events outside of the operators ability to control d all remedies provided herein shall be cumulative and in addition to any other remedy provided by law no delay or failure by the city to exercise any right shall constitute a waiver of such right e in the event the city must prosecute or defend against litigation judicial or administrative to enforce the terms of this article a preexisting franchise ordinance or the franchise agreement against the franchise operator and the city prevails the operator shall be liable for the citys legal costs including reasonable attorneys fees whether house attorneys or outside counsel and litigation expenses of every kind including paralegal expert witness and consultant fees this provision shall survive any termination of an operators franchise for claims arising during the terms of the franchise f venue for any actions involving this article a preexisting franchise ordinance or a franchise agreement shall be in the circuit or city court depending on the rules of jurisdiction of said courts or in the federal district court in which the city is located to the extent concurrent jurisdiction is conferred by the federal cable communications act or its successor or any applicable federal statute  31400 supplementing existing franchises all existing cable tv franchises shall remain in effect but shall be subject to the standards terms and conditions contained in this article such additional standards terms and conditions except for the duration of the franchise and the franchise fee shall prevail over any inconsistent provision of any existing ordinance granting a franchise for cable tv a confirming franchise agreement will be issued to each such cable tv operator within 60 days after the effective date of this article which shall include the procedures for payment of the franchise fee public liability and workers compensation insurance requirements inspections and audit authority for payment of the franchise fee and such other terms as are appropriate  31400 article iii  cable communications system footnotes  2  editors note  adopted oct 17 200 amended the adding provisions that were not specifically amendatory at the editors discretion said provisions were included herein as  27512792 intent and purposes the purposes of this article are to 1 protect the public health safety and welfare  2 provide for the granting of one or more franchises to permit the use of city streets and other public ways for cable communication systems  3 provide for the regulation by the city of the erection construction reconstruction installation operation maintenance dismantling testing repair and use of cable communication systems in upon along across above over and under or in any manner connected with the streets or other public ways within the city as it now or in the future may exist  4 provide for the payment of fees and other valuable considerations to the city for the use of city streets and other public ways by cable communication systems as well as to compensate the city for costs associated with such use  5 provide for the development of cable communication systems as a means to improve communications and serve the present and future needs of the citizens government and private and public institutions organizations and enterprises of the city  6 provide remedies and prescribe penalties for violations of this article and any franchise agreements executed pursuant to this article  and 7 provide for a level playing field for all companies providing service  101706 definitions for the purposes of this article the following terms phrases words and their derivation shall have the meaning given herein basic service means service tiers which include the delivery of local broadcast stations and access channels the basic service does not include optional program tiers a la carte services per channel per program or auxiliary services for which a separate charge is made however franchisee may include other signals on the basic tier cable system or cable television system or system means a system of antennas cables wires lines towers waveguides optical fiber or other conductors converters equipment or facilities designed and constructed for the purpose of producing receiving transmitting amplifying and distributing audio video and other forms of electronic electrical or optical signals which the city legally can regulate and located in the city the definition shall not include any such facility that serves or will serve only subscribers in one or more multiple unit dwellings under common ownership control or management and which does not use city rightsofway channel means a portion of the electromagnetic frequency spectrum which is used in a cable system and which is capable of delivering a television channel as a television channel is defined by the federal communications commission city means the city of palm coast florida control andor controlling interest shall mean actual working control of a system in whatever manner exercised a change in the control or controlling interest of an entity which has control or a controlling interest in a franchisee shall constitute a change in the control or controlling interest of the system under the same criteria control or controlling interest as used herein may be held simultaneously by more than one person or entity converter means an electronic device which converts signals to a frequency not susceptible to interference within the television receiver of a subscriber and by an appropriate channel selector also permits a subscriber to view more than 12 channels delivered by the system at designated converter dial locations drop shall mean the cable or wire that connects the distribution portion of a cable system to a subscribers premises fcc means the federal communications commission and any legally appointed designated or elected agent or successor franchise means the nonexclusive right granted authority of a franchise agreement between the city and a franchisee hereunder which allows the franchisee to own operate construct reconstruct upgrade dismantle test use and maintain a cable system within the corporate boundaries of the city and is not intended to include any license or permit required for the privilege of transacting and carrying on a business within the city as may be required by other laws or ordinances of the city franchise agreement means that certain written agreement entered into between a franchisee and the city wherein the franchise and the terms thereof are conferred upon the franchisee franchisee means a person or entity to whom or which a franchise under this chapter is granted by the city along with the lawful successors or assigns of such person or entity gross revenues means all revenue received directly or indirectly by the franchisee from the provision of cable services within the city including but not limited to basic subscriber service monthly fees pay cable fees installation and reconnection fees franchise fees late fees and fees for cable modem service  in the event that cable modem service is classified as a cable service by a court of competent jurisdiction in a final ruling leased channel fees converter rentals downgrade fees advertising revenue less agency fees  provided however that this shall not include any taxes on services furnished by the franchisee herein imposed directly upon any subscriber or user by the state local or other governmental unit and collected by the franchisee on behalf of the governmental unit or the portion of the money received by the franchisee which is attainable to the franchise fee as that term is used in applicable law service area means all areas in the city installation means the connection of the system from feeder cable to subscribers terminals may is permissive monitoring means observing a communications signal or the absence of a signal where the observer is neither the subscriber nor the programmer whether the signal is observed by visual or electronic means for any purpose whatsoever  provided monitoring shall not include systemwide nonindividually addressed sweeps of the system for purposes of verifying system integrity controlling return paths transmissions or billing for pay services normal business hours shall mean those hours during which most similar businesses in the community are open to serve customers as defined by federal regulations normal operating conditions shall mean those service conditions which are within the control of the franchisee those conditions which are not within the control of the franchisee include but are not limited to natural disasters civil disturbances power outages telephone network outages and severe or unusual weather conditions those conditions which are ordinarily within the control of the franchisee include but are not limited to special promotions rate increases regular peak or seasonal demand periods and maintenance or upgrade of a cable system educational or governmental access facilities means channel capacity designated for educational or governmental use and facilities and equipment for the use of such channel capacity service interruption means the loss of picture or sound on one or more channels shall is mandatory street means the surface of and all rightsofway and the space above and below any public street road highway freeway lane path public way or place sidewalk alley court boulevard parkway drive or easement now or hereafter held by the city for the purpose of public travel and shall include other easements or rightsofway as shall be now held or hereafter held by the city which shall within their proper use and meaning entitle the franchisee to the use thereof for the purposes of installing poles wires cable conductors ducts conduits vaults manholes amplifiers appliances attachments optical fiber and other property as may be ordinarily necessary and pertinent to a cable television system subscriber shall mean any person firm corporation or association lawfully receiving basic andor additional cable service from franchisee user means a party utilizing a cable television system channel for purposes of production or transmission of material to subscribers as contrasted with receipt thereof in a subscriber capacity  101706 conflicting provisions a this article is adopted pursuant to the authority of the city under the constitutions and statutes of the state of florida and the united states of america including but not limited to the cable communication policy act of 198 47 usc 521 the cable consumer protection and competition act of 199 the telecommunications act of 199 and florida statutes  and  b in the case of a conflict between a provision in this article and either a provision in a franchise agreement executed pursuant to this article or a provision in a franchise proposal that is incorporated by reference into such franchise agreement this article shall control unless the franchise agreement expresses an explicit intent to waive a requirement of this article  101706 use of streets a before any construction is commenced the franchisee shall obtain all required and approved construction permits from the city and any other permits as may be required by law franchisee shall pay any and all inspection fees associated with obtaining such permits the city shall have the right to inspect all construction or installation work performed by the franchisee in the citys streets in the event of damage to property caused by franchisee then franchisee must restore private property and public thoroughfares to their former conditions in a reasonable manner acceptable to the city or the private property owner as the case may be  if this is not done within 30 days barring unforeseen circumstances the city or private property owner may after prior written notice to franchisee cause reasonable repairs to be made at the expense of franchisee b the facilities shall be so located or relocated and so erected or installed so as not to obstruct or interfere with the use of streets alleys easements and other public ways and places or other utilities or structures already installed or hereinafter to be installed subject at all times to the lawful police power of the city any unreasonable obstruction of any street alley avenue bridge easement or other public place or way of the city not promptly removed by the franchisee after written notice by the city demanding removal thereof or not properly repaired by the franchisee after its work therein after written notice by city demanding repair thereof may be removed or repaired as the case may be by the city and all reasonable costs thereof shall be charged against said franchisee and shall be collectible by the city in any lawful manner c franchisee may trim trees on private property at the franchisees expense with prior approval of the property owner franchisee may trim trees on public rightsofway at its own expense but only after written notification to and the approval of the city approval will be deemed granted within three business days after written notification to the city if the city has not contacted the franchisee in addition removal of trees for new construction shall first require tree removal permits to be obtained by the franchisee at its expense d at the request of any person holding a valid building moving permit the franchisee must temporarily raise lower or cut its wires as necessary to facilitate such move upon not less than five business days advance notice the direct expense of such temporary changes must be paid by the permit holder and the franchisee may require payment in advance e franchisee must utilize existing poles conduits or other such facilities wherever possible if available on reasonable terms and conditions all transmission lines and structures must be installed to cause minimum interference with the rights and reasonable convenience of property owners franchisee must obtain permission from the city before erecting any new poles or underground conduit at the time franchisee seeks to install any new lines approval shall not be unreasonably withheld f on streets and roads where electrical and telephone utility wiring is installed underground at the time of the initial cable construction or if subsequently both go underground cable must also be installed underground at no expense to the city except to the extent the city bears the expenses of other parties similarly situated if both electric and telephone utility wiring is aerial franchisee may install aerial cable except where a property owner or resident requests underground installation and property owner or resident agrees to bear the additional cost over aerial construction g the city shall give franchisee reasonable notice of plans for street improvements when paving or resurfacing of a permanent nature is involved any relocation required by the city because of said improvements shall be at the expense of the franchisee if all or part of a street within the city is closed or discontinued franchisee shall not be entitled to damages from the city due to the closing or discontinuance of such street because of removal or relocation of lines or cables by the franchisee in said streets however if funding becomes available to the city for undergrounding to reimburse users in the public rights of way then cable franchisees will be reimbursed for their costs of relocation in the same manner as other users of the rights of way are reimbursed h all poles lines structures and other facilities of franchisee in on over and under the streets sidewalks alleys easements and other public grounds or places within city shall be kept by franchisee at all times in a safe sound and substantial condition i the franchisees work while in progress shall be properly protected at all times with suitable barricades flags lights flares or other devices to protect all members of the public having occasion to use the portion of the streets involved or adjacent property  101706 grant of authority  franchise required a the city may grant one or more franchises in accordance with this article b no person shall commence construction of a cable system on the public rightsofway or operate a cable system in the city without receiving a franchise granted by the city and executing a franchise agreement with the city  101706 franchise characteristics a a franchise authorizes use of the public rightsofway for installing cables wires lines optical fiber and other facilities to operate a cable system within a specified area of the city but does not expressly or implicitly authorize the franchisee to provide service to or install cables wires lines optical fiber or any other equipment or facilities upon private property without owner consent except for use of compatible easements pursuant to 47 usc  541a2 or as otherwise provided by law or to use publicly or privately owned utility poles or conduits without a separate agreement with the owners b a franchise is nonexclusive and will not expressly or implicitly preclude the issuance of other franchises to operate cable systems within the city or affect the citys right to authorize use of public rightsofway to other persons as it determines appropriate a franchise shall not be granted on terms or conditions more favorable or less burdensome than those in any existing franchise c once a franchise agreement has been accepted and executed by the city and a franchisee such franchise agreement shall constitute a contract between the franchisee and the city and the terms conditions and provisions of such franchise agreement together with all duly enacted and applicable laws ordinances codes rules regulations and orders shall define the rights and obligations of the franchisee and the city relating to the franchise except as set forth in section 2790a  101706 franchise subject to other laws a a franchisee is subject to and must comply with all generally applicable local city state and federal laws ordinances codes rules regulations and orders b except as may be specifically provided in this article or under the terms of a franchise agreement the failure of the city upon one or more occasions to exercise a right or to require compliance or performance under the article or a franchise agreement shall not be deemed to constitute a waiver of such right or waiver of compliance or performance in the future  101706 interpretation of franchise terms a subject to provisions of section 2790 the provisions of this article will apply to a franchise agreement and the express terms of this article will prevail over conflicting or inconsistent provisions in a franchise agreement unless such franchise agreement expresses an explicit intent to waive a requirement of the article b the provisions of a franchise agreement will be liberally construed to effectuate its purposes and objectives consistent with this article and the public interest except where federal law or regulation is controlling a franchise agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of florida  101706 grant of franchises a generally the city may grant a franchise for a period not to exceed ten years although a longer franchise term up to a 15 year term may be granted if the city council finds it would better meet community needs and interests b the city may make the grant of a franchise conditioned upon the completion of construction within a prescribed time or upon the performance of other specific obligations which are to be set forth in the franchise agreement specifying that failure to timely comply with the condition will cause the franchisee to be in material breach of its franchise agreement and become subject to penalties pursuant to this article and the franchise agreement violations listed in section 2784 shall be considered material breaches of this article c in evaluating an application for a new franchise the city shall consider among other things the following factors the applicants character its technical financial and legal qualifications to construct and operate the proposed system  the nature of the proposed facilities equipment and services  the applicants record in other communities if any  the economic impact on private property within the proposed service area  the capability of the public rightsofway to accommodate the proposed system  potential disruption to existing users of the public rightsofway and the public  and whether the proposal will meet reasonably anticipated community needs and serve the public interest where an applicant proposes an overbuild of an existing cable system the city shall also consider pursuant to florida statutes the economic feasibility of multiple cable operators the impact on the existing franchisee including whether the operations of an existing cable franchisee will be interfered with or disrupted and whether any adverse consequences to the public interest will result if the application is granted d the council shall hold a public hearing to consider any new application based upon the application the testimony presented at the public hearing any recommendations of the city manager and any other information it deems relevant to the application the council shall decide whether to grant or deny a franchise application and the terms and conditions of a grant any grant of a franchise shall be under terms and conditions that are not more favorable or less burdensome than those in an existing franchise e if the council grants an initial franchise application the city manager and the applicant must agree on the terms of a franchise agreement within 90 calendar days from the date city council approves the grant this time period may be extended for good cause by the city if agreement is not reached with the city within 90 calendar days or if the period is not extended by the city the franchise grant will be null and void without further action by the city f after complying with the above requirements the council following a public hearing and considering the testimony presented at the public hearing any recommendations of the city manager and any other relevant information shall approve or disapprove the proposed franchise agreement by resolution g a franchisee must demonstrate compliance with the surety insurance and similar provisions of the franchise agreement  101706 complaints a franchisee shall maintain and operate its system and render efficient service in accordance with the rules and regulations which are or which may be set forth by the city from time to time in the exercise of its authority under applicable law and subject to section 2790a of this article b whenever it is necessary to shut off or interrupt service for the making of repairs installations or adjustments franchisee shall do so at such times as will cause the least amount of inconvenience to its customers and unless such interruption is unforeseen and immediately necessary it will give reasonable notice thereof to its customers c the franchisee shall maintain an office located convenient to the city which shall be open at reasonable hours for receiving complaints from subscribers and nonsubscribers said complaints shall be investigated and if attributable to the system corrected within the time frames set forth in section 2773 of this article  101706 rates a before any service is sold to any customer a franchisee shall file with the city manager its schedule of rates for installation and monthly service charges and any other information required by the federal rules b subsequent additions or amendments to rates service charges and rights and obligations statements shall likewise be filed with the city manager at least 30 days before the same become effective simultaneously a franchisee shall also provide subscribers to the cable system with written notification of any such additions or amendments at least 30 days before the same become effective c in the event that any state or federal law or regulation is at any time after the effective date of this article enacted changed modified interpreted amended repealed or invalidated so as to allow for the citys regulation of rates paid by cable subscribers the city may at its option regulate such rates as permitted by law d rate regulation proceedings shall be conducted at a duly noticed public hearing to ensure that all interested parties have a reasonable opportunity to present their views the council may conduct such hearings at its regularly scheduled meeting or at a meeting scheduled solely for the purpose of regulating rates e to the extent allowed by state and federal law nothing in this section shall prevent a franchisee from applying a surcharge or late payment penalty to subscriber bills to reflect balances due the franchisee which are delinquent for 20 days or more  101706 indemnification a prior to the beginning of any work by the franchisee within the prescribed limits of the city the franchisee shall file with the city and shall keep in force and effect at all times during the effective period hereof insurance certification evidencing a commercial general liability insurance policy in the amount of $200000000 per occurrence combined single limit the terms and conditions whereof shall be such as to provide for the protection and indemnification of the city with respect to claims of any person or corporation suffering injury loss or damage to person or property by reason of the construction operation or maintenance of its cable television system within the prescribed limits of the city both the city and franchisee shall be named as insured and there shall be no right of subrogation against the city such insurance policy shall be subject to the acceptance and approval of the city which shall not be unreasonably withheld franchisee must have management rating in bests insurance guide of bb or better franchisee shall obligate itself to notify the city in writing at least 30 days before any alteration modification or cancellation of such policy is to become effective which would result in noncompliance with this provision b a franchisee shall at its sole costs and expense indemnify save harmless and defend the city and all its agents officials and employees from any and all claims demands actions or causes of action proceedings judgments for damages or equitable relief brought against the city based on personal injury bodily injury including death the conduct of a franchisees business in the city or property damages including destruction received or claimed to be received or sustained by any person or persons arising from or in connection with the franchisees performance of its franchise agreement with the city this provision shall include but is not limited to the citys reasonable attorneys fees incurred in defending against any such claim suit or proceedings  claims arising out of copyright infringements or a failure by a franchisee to secure consents from owners authorized distributors or providers or programs to be delivered by the cable system  claims against a franchisee for invasion of the right of privacy defamation of any person firm or corporation or the violation or infringement of any copyright trademark trade name service mark or patent or of any other right of any person franchisee shall defend the city in any action or proceeding commenced for the purpose of asserting any claim arising under a franchisees performance of its franchise agreement except for any claim asserted by a franchisee or asserted by the city against a franchisee city shall receive advance consent in writing before settling any dispute that is subject to indemnification by the franchisee nothing herein shall be construed as consent by an agency or subdivision of the state of florida to be sued by third parties in any matter arising out of this article or a franchise agreement  or as a waiver of sovereign immunity by any party to which sovereign immunity applies  101706 service area the franchisee shall provide service to the entire city in accordance with the requirements of section 2772b the city council may hold a public hearing as provided in section 2783c and d if after receiving complaints and making an investigation it is determined that the franchisee is not endeavoring to expand its service in the franchise area  101706 franchise fee a a franchisee shall pay the communications services tax provided in the communications services tax simplification law florida statutes as that law has been and may hereinafter be amended or renumbered and any city of palm coast ordinances or resolutions enacted pursuant to such law in the event that florida statutes is held to be unconstitutional invalid or unenforceable a franchisee as compensation for the privilege granted under a franchise for the use of the public rightsofway to construct maintain and operate a cable system shall pay the city a franchise fee in an amount of either 1 five percent of the franchisees gross revenues  or 2 in the event 47 usc  542 or other applicable law is amended to permit the city to assess a franchise fee of a greater percentage or amount than that specified in subsection 1 above or on a broader revenue basis than defined in this chapter the franchisee shall during the remaining term of any existing franchise or in a renewal franchise pay the city the new percentage or amount as established at any time by the commission after a public hearing of which the franchisee has received notice provided that the percentage of revenue and the revenue base for the franchise fee do not exceed those paid by franchisee to any other franchising authority in volusia orange osceola brevard or seminole counties b i and all references to franchise fees gross revenues and associated reporting requirements mentioned in this article or a franchise agreement do not apply as long as the communications services tax or similar regulatory provisions are in effect b a franchisee shall pay the franchise fee due to the city on a quarterly basis payment for each quarter shall be made to the city not later than 45 calendar days after the end of each calendar quarter all payments shall be accompanied by a calculation of gross revenue certified by a certified public accountant or the franchisees chief financial officer c a franchisee shall file with the city on a quarterly basis a financial statement setting forth the computation of gross revenues used to calculate the franchise fee for the preceding quarter and a detailed explanation of the method of computation showing the revenue derived from each category of the franchisees operations the statement shall be verified by a financial representative of franchisee or the franchisees chief financial officer the franchisee shall bear the cost of the preparation of such financial statements d subject to applicable law no acceptance by the city of any franchise fee payment shall be construed as an accord that the amount paid is in fact the correct amount nor shall such acceptance of payment be construed as a release of any claim the city may have for additional sums payable e the franchise fee payment is not a payment in lieu of any other tax fee or assessment f in the event that florida law so permits the city may from time to time and upon reasonable notice but in no event not less than seven days prior notice inspect and audit any and all books and records of the franchisee relevant to the determination of gross revenues and the computation of franchise fees due inspections audits and recomputations may be performed by either the city or an independent firm selected by the city and qualified for such purposes no audit of a franchisees records relating to gross annual revenues shall take place later than 36 months following the close of each of the franchisees fiscal years the cost of the audit shall be borne by the franchisee if as a result of the audit the city determines that the franchisee has underpaid the franchise fees owed in an amount equal to or exceeding four percent of the franchise fees actually paid a franchisee shall make all books and records necessary to satisfactorily perform the audit readily available for inspection to the auditors in the city or in the alternative the franchisee shall pay all costs necessary for the city to perform the audit at a location outside the city any additional amount due to the city as a result of the audit shall be paid within 30 days of notice by the city unless the franchisee disputes within 15 days the results of the audit in the event the franchisee disputes the results the franchisee will meet with the city and will attempt in good faith to resolve any differences thereafter the additional amount due shall be subject to payment within 30 days after said additional amount is determined to be due by the franchisee and the city g in the event that a franchise fee payment is not received by the city on or before the due date set forth in subsection b above or is underpaid the franchisee shall pay a late charge equal to the prime interest rate as published in the wall street journal plus two percent of the amount of the unpaid or underpaid franchise fee payment provided however that such rate does not exceed the maximum amount allowed under florida law and that the franchisee shall not be responsible for paying interest on delinquent franchise fees resulting from erroneous database information provided by the city any interest andor late charge paid by the franchisee is intended to be a charge incidental to the enforcement of a franchise within the meaning of 47 usc  542g2d and may not be deducted from the franchise fee imposed by this article or any franchise agreement furthermore the city may invoke all rights and remedies available under applicable law and this article h when a franchise terminates for whatever reason the franchisee shall file with the city within 60 calendar days of the date its operations in the city of palm coast cease a financial statement verified by a financial representative or the franchisees chief financial officer showing the gross revenues received by the franchisee since the end of the previous fiscal year adjustments shall be made at that time for franchise fees due to the date that the franchisees operations ceased i any transaction or arrangement which has the effect of circumventing payment of franchise fees andor evasion of payment of franchise fees for example by noncollection of revenues nonreporting of revenues collection of revenues by parents affiliates or subsidiaries bartering or any other means from the operation of the franchisees cable system to provide cable service in the city of palm coast is strictly prohibited  101706 maps the franchisee shall at all times keep an accurate asbuilt map showing the location of all facilities erected constructed and maintained by the franchisee under the provisions of this franchise and the maps shall be made available for inspection by the city during normal business hours upon request  101706 reports and records a as soon as available and upon the request of the city a franchisee shall provide the city an annual report that includes the following information 1 a summary of the previous calendar years activities in development of the system including but not limited to services begun or dropped number of subscribers including gains and losses homes passed and miles of cable distribution lines in service the summary shall also include a comparison of any construction including system upgrades during the year with any projections previously provided to the city 2 if franchisee pays franchise fees directly to the city a franchisee shall submit to the city and bear the cost of an annual gross revenue report prepared according to generally accepted accounting principles such reports shall be certified by the corporate officer responsible for the preparation of the gross revenue report expressing an opinion thereon at any other time upon request of the city the franchisee shall submit any further information regarding the franchisees performance of the franchise agreement as may be required by the city 3 a summary of written subscriber or consumer complaints or those complaints requiring a service call identifying the number and nature of complaints and their disposition where complaints involve one or more recurrent system problems the nature of each problem and what steps have been taken to correct it shall be identified when available more detailed information on complaints shall be submitted upon request of the city 4 if the franchisee is a corporation a list of officers and members of the board and the local officers and board members of any parent corporation  and where a parent corporations stock is publicly traded a copy of its most recent annual report 5 a list of all partners or known stockholders holding five percent or more ownership interest in the franchisee and any parent corporation  provided however when any such entity has more than ten persons holding five percent ownership interest the ten largest such holders shall be listed alternatively the annual ownership information required by the fcc for broadcast licensees may be supplied or if a parent corporations stock is publicly traded a copy of its most recent annual report shall suffice 6 a copy of customer notifications provided under section 2773 7 a report on the number of senior citizens or economically disadvantaged groups of subscribers receiving rate discounts if any b within 30 days of a request by the city a franchisee shall make available to the city books and records adequate to enable the franchisee to demonstrate that it is in compliance with the requirements of this article and the franchise agreement this provision shall not be deemed as a waiver of a franchisees right to assert that the information sought by the city is proprietary and should not be disclosed and to withhold such information upon the agreement of the city if the city manager does not concur with such assertion then the franchisee may appeal such decision to the city council in accordance with applicable laws and procedures if the city council finds the books and records should be disclosed and if the franchisee does not appeal such decision to a court of law then the franchisee shall promptly provide such documents including the alleged proprietary portion thereof to the city the city shall maintain confidentiality of information provided by the franchisee when franchisee has designated such information as proprietary if legally possible the city shall provide franchisee with notice of any request by a third party for such information  101706 discrimination prohibited a unless approved by the city or to the extent consistent with federal law no franchisee may in its rates or charges or in the availability of the services or facilities of its system or in any other respect make or grant illegal preferences or advantages to any subscriber or potential subscriber to the system or to any user or potential user of the system nor subject any such persons to any illegal prejudice or any disadvantage  provided however a franchisee may offer discounts in order to attract or maintain subscribers so long as such discounts are offered on a legally nondiscriminatory basis within the service area a franchisee must not deny delay or otherwise burden service or discriminate against subscribers or users on the basis of age race creed religion color sex disability status national origin marital status except for discounts for senior citizens or economically disadvantaged groups of subscribers that are applied in a uniform and consistent manner b a franchisee must not deny cable service to any potential subscribers because of the income of the residents of the area in which the subscribers reside c franchisee may offer services to commercial subscribers at rates different than those charged residential subscribers and may enter into separate contracts with multiple dwelling unit buildings franchisee may also charge different rates for services based upon single point billing or other contractual considerations  101706 waiver nothing in this franchise shall be construed as a surrender by the city of its right or power to pass ordinances regulating the use of its streets and other public ways  neither shall the franchisee be relieved from paying a reasonable annual business license fee and such taxes as may be levied from time to time by appropriate government entities  101706 taxes nothing herein shall be construed as affecting in any manner the right of city to levy or collect taxes payable by the consumer for services provided by the franchisee as now authorized under the laws of the state of florida  101706 transfers a a transfer of a franchise shall not occur without prior approval of the city b an application to transfer a franchise must provide complete information on the proposed transaction including details on the legal character financial technical and other pertinent qualifications of the transferee at minimum the information required in fcc form 394 must be provided by the transferor and transferee the information required in section 2771e510 must also be provided whenever the proposed transferee expects material changes to occur in those areas c an application for approval of a transfer to an entity under common control with franchisee shall be considered granted on the 31st calendar day following its filing with the city unless prior to that date the franchisee is notified to the contrary an application for approval of such a pro forma transfer shall clearly identify the application as such d the city manager shall make recommendations to the council on each transfer application submitted to the council for final action the council shall hold a public hearing before taking final action on an application for transfer of a franchise e in making a determination on whether to grant an application to transfer a franchise the council will consider the legal financial technical and character qualifications of the transferee to operate the system and whether operation by the franchisee would adversely affect the cable services to subscribers the franchisee will provide all information necessary to this determination the transferee will take on all the obligations of the franchisee under this article and the franchise agreement f approval by the city of a transfer of a franchise does not constitute a waiver or release of any of the rights of the city under this article or a franchise agreement  101706 application for grant modification or transfer of franchises a an application must be filed with the city for grant of a new franchise modification of a franchise agreement or a transfer of a franchise an applicant shall provide the city with such information as the city may reasonably request to demonstrate compliance with all requirements of the article and of federal law b to be acceptable for filing an application must be submitted in the number of copies required by the city conform to any applicable request for proposals and contain all required information all applications must include the names and addresses of persons authorized to act on behalf of the applicant with respect to the application c all applications accepted for filing must be made available by the city for public inspection d an application for the grant of a new franchise may be filed pursuant to a request for proposals issued by the city or on an unsolicited basis the city upon receipt of an unsolicited application may issue a request for proposals if the city elects to issue a request for proposals upon receipt of an unsolicited application the applicant may submit an amended application in response to the request for proposals or may inform the city that its unsolicited application should be considered in response to the request for proposals or may withdraw its unsolicited application an application which does not conform to the requirements of a request for proposals may be considered nonresponsive e an application for the grant of an initial franchise must contain at minimum the following information provided however that any party providing cable services in the city as of the effective date of this article shall not be required to provide the information specified in subsections 4 5 6 10 and 13 below 1 name and address of the applicant and identification of the ownership and control of the applicant including the names and addresses of the ten largest holders of an ownership interest in the applicant and all persons with five percent or more ownership interest  the persons who control the applicant  all local officers and directors of the applicant  a description of the applicants other business affiliations and cable system ownership interests where the applicant or the parent corporation of the applicant issues stock which is publicly traded a copy of its most recent annual report shall suffice in lieu of the above information  2 an indication of whether the applicant or any person controlling the applicant or major stockholder of the applicant has been adjudged bankrupt had a cable franchise revoked or been found guilty by any court or administrative agency of a violation of a security or antitrust law or a felony or any crime involving moral turpitude  and if so identification of any such person or entity and a full explanation of the circumstances  3 a demonstration of the applicants technical legal and financial ability to construct and operate the proposed cable facility including identification of key personnel  4 a description of applicants prior experience in cable operations and identification of communities in which applicant or its principals have or had a cable franchise or an interest therein including the identification of any litigation between any such franchisees and their franchising authorities  5 a detailed description of the physical facility proposed including channel capacity technical design performance characteristics headend and access facilities to be provided to satisfy the requirements of this article  6 a description of the construction of the proposed system including an estimate of aboveground and belowground mileage and its location the proposed construction schedule a description where appropriate of how services will be converted from existing facilities to new facilities and information on the availability of space on poles and conduits including where appropriate an estimate of the cost of rearrangement of facilities to accommodate such use  7 for informational purposes a description of the services to be provided initially including all broadcast and nonbroadcast signals to be carried and all nontelevision services to be delivered over the cable system and if services will be offered by tiers identification of the signals andor services to be included on each tier  8 for informational purposes the proposed rate structure including charges for each service tier installation and other equipment or services  9 a demonstration of how the proposal will reasonably meet the future cablerelated needs and interests of the community including a description of how the proposal will meet the needs described in any recent community needs assessment conducted by or for the city  10 pro forma financial projections for the franchise term including statement of projected income and expenses and a schedule of planned capital additions with all significant assumptions explained in notes or supporting schedules  11 an affidavit of the applicant or authorized officer certifying the truth and accuracy of the information in the application and acknowledging the enforceability of application commitments and certifying that the proposal meets all federal and state requirements  12 if an applicant proposes to provide cable service to an area already served by an existing cable franchisee the identification of the area where the overbuild would occur the potential subscriber density in the area which would encompass the overbuild and other information as necessary for the city to make its determination pursuant to section 2759c  13 if the applicant does not propose to provide institutional services an explanation of why it does not  and 14 any other information as may be reasonably necessary to demonstrate compliance with the requirements of this article or any information that the city may request of applicant that is relevant to the citys consideration of the application f an application for modification of a franchise must include at minimum the following information 1 the specific modification requested  2 the justification for the requested modification including the impact of the requested modification on subscribers and others and the impact on the applicant if the modification is not approved  3 a statement whether the modification is sought pursuant to of the cable act 47 usc  545 and if so a demonstration that the requested modification meets the legal standards of 47 usc  545  and 4 any other information necessary for the city to make a determination g an application for renewal of a franchise must comply with the requirements of section 2775 h an application for approval of a transfer of a franchise must comply with the requirements of section 2770  101706 minimum facilities and services a the following minimum requirements for facilities and services apply to all franchises except where expressly specified in a franchise document the city may require in a franchise agreement that a franchisee exceed these minimum requirements where it determines under circumstances existing at the time of the application that the higher requirements are necessary to meet reasonable public needs taking into account the costs thereof and that such requirements are consistent with current stateoftheart capabilities and are economically feasible 1 any cable system construction occurring after the effective date of this article shall have a minimum capacity of 78 video channels available for immediate or potential use and have the capability for twoway communications 2 a franchisee shall be required to make available without charge unlimited time on up to two channels as follows a a local government access channel for noncommercial local governmental use the allocation and use of such to be determined by the council to the extent permitted by applicable law a franchisee shall be required to make this local government access channel available as part of its lowest basic service level franchisee shall provide to the city a switch to permit the city to insert the programming of the flagler county government channel onto the city government access channel some customers may not receive the city of palm coast access channel due to the fact that the technical design of the cable system does not precisely correspond to municipal boundaries  but in all events the franchisee shall within a reasonable period of time provide the city of palm coast access channel to city residentssubscribers on any node on which the majority of subscribers are residents of the city of palm coast b provide an educational access channel if specified in the franchise agreement c contribute a capital grant andor access equipment for such access channel for educational andor governmental use that will be specifically defined in a franchise agreement d submit to the city on an annual basis a plan for publicizing if specified in a franchise agreement 3 a franchisee shall be required to provide basic and standard service offering without charge to facilities within the city passed by the cable system which are owned and occupied by the local governmental entity and all flagler county public schools excluding home schools for educational or governmental use such service shall be provided by means of a single drop extending to the facility or in the event the facility consists of more than one building to a single building within such facility selected by the governmental entity the franchisee shall not be required to extend such single drop more than 125 feet from the cable distribution line with the expense of any additional extension to be borne by the entity being served such single drop may be internally extended by the governmental entity without cost to or responsibility of the franchisee subject to such internal distribution meeting all fcc requirements relative to signal leakage in the event of the addition of a new building eligible for service under this subsection during the life of a franchise agreement the franchisee may be required to provide such service within 90 days of a request by the city to do so excluding circumstances beyond franchisees control 4 a franchisee shall comply with fcc requirements for emergency alert services 5 a franchisee shall make available to its subscribers equipment capable of decoding closed circuit captioning information for the hearing impaired a franchisee may charge for such equipment b a franchisee shall make cable service available to every dwelling within the city where the dwelling is in an area with a minimum density of 20 dwellings per cable mile as measured from the franchisees existing cable plant density per cable mile shall be computed by dividing the number of residential dwelling units in the area by the length in miles or fractions thereof of the total amount of aerial or underground cable necessary to make service available to the residential dwelling units in such area in accordance with franchisees system design parameters the cable length shall be measured from the nearest technically feasible point of access to the thenexisting system which is located within the public rightsofway the total cable length shall exclude the drop cable necessary to serve individual subscriber premises where potential subscribers reside in a portion of the service area with dwelling density below the prescribed minimum the franchisee shall extend service to such potential subscribers under the following conditions 1 if they are willing to pay a one time charge equivalent to the franchisees construction cost per dwelling in each cable mile area  or 2 if 15 potential subscribers per cable mile measured from the existing cable feeder plan commit themselves to taking service in a manner reasonably satisfactory to the franchisee  101706 minimum customer service standards a cable system office hours and telephone availability 1 the franchisee will maintain a local tollfree or collect call telephone access lines which will be available to its subscribers 24 hours a day seven days a week a trained franchisee representatives will be available to respond to customer telephone inquiries during normal business hours b after normal business hours the access line may be answered by a service or an automated response system including an answering machine inquiries received after normal business hours must be responded to by a trained franchisee representative on the next business day 2 under normal operating conditions telephone answer time by a customer representative including wait time shall not exceed 30 seconds when the connection is made if the call needs to be transferred transfer time shall not exceed 30 seconds these standards shall be met no less than 90 percent of the time under normal operating conditions measured on a quarterly basis 3 the franchisee will not be required to obtain equipment or perform surveys to measure compliance with the telephone answering standards above unless an historical record of the complaints taken by the franchising authority indicates a clear failure to comply 4 under normal operating conditions the customer will receive a busy signal less than three percent of the time 5 customer service center and bill payment locations will be open at least during normal business hours and will be an office location convenient to palm coast in flagler county florida b installations outages and service calls under normal operating conditions each of the following four standards will be met no less than 95 percent of the time measured on a quarterly basis 1 standard installations will be performed within seven business days after an order has been placed standard installations are those that are located up to 125 feet from the existing distribution system 2 excluding conditions beyond the control of the operator the cable operator will begin working on service interruptions promptly and in no event later than 24 hours after the interruption becomes known the franchisee must begin actions to correct other service problems the next business day after notification of the service problem 3 the appointment window alternatives for installations service calls and other installation activities will be either a specific time or at maximum a fourhour time block during normal business hours the operator may schedule service calls and other installation activities outside of normal business hours for the express convenience of the customer 4 a franchisee may not cancel an appointment with a customer after the close of business on the business day prior to the scheduled appointment 5 if a franchisees representative is running late for an appointment with a customer and will not be able to keep the appointment as scheduled the customer will be contacted no later than 30 minutes after the scheduled time the appointment will be rescheduled as necessary at a time which is convenient for the customer provided it is within the franchisees normal time frame for service calls c communications between franchisees and cable subscribers 1 notifications to subscribers a the franchisee shall provide written information on each of the following areas at the time of installation of service and at least annually to all subscribers or at any time upon request 1 products and services offered  2 prices and options for programming services and conditions of subscription to programming and other services  3 installation and service maintenance policies  4 instructions on how to use the cable service  5 channel positions of programming carried on the system  and 6 billing and complaint procedures including the address and telephone number of the local franchise authoritys cable office b customers will be notified of any changes in rates programming services or channel positions as soon as possible in writing notice must be given to subscribers a minimum of 30 days in advance of such changes if the change is within the control of the cable operator in addition the franchisee operator shall notify subscribers 30 days in advance of any significant changes in the other information required by the preceding paragraph d billing 1 bills will be clear concise and understandable bills must be fully itemized with itemizations including but not limited to basic and premium service charges and equipment charges bills also will clearly delineate all activity during the billing period including optional charges rebates and credits 2 in case of a billing dispute the franchisee must respond to a written complaint from a subscriber within 30 days e refunds refund checks will be issued promptly but not later than either 1 the customers next billing cycle following resolution of the request or 30 days whichever is earlier or 2 thirty days after the return of the equipment supplied by the cable operator if service is terminated f credits credits for service will be issued no later than the customers next billing cycle following the determination that a credit is warranted subscriber credit for outages upon service interruption of a subscribers cable service and upon subscriber request the following shall apply grantee shall provide a credit for lost cable service of not less than the value of the actual time without service due to an outage or interruption of cable service lasting at least four or more hours  101706 customer complaints a all complaints against a franchisee relating to its performance including but not limited to those concerning quality of service equipment malfunction and billing disputes shall be received at the cable office a franchisee shall endeavor to respond to any complaints by the next business day b excluding conditions beyond its control the franchisee will begin working on service interruptions promptly and in no event later than 24 hours after the interruption becomes known the franchisee must begin actions to correct other service problems the next business day after notification of the service problem the standards of this subsection will be met no less than 95 percent of the time measured on a quarterly basis c upon request a franchisee shall deliver to the city manager or other city official duly designated by the city manager a report regarding any complaints which have not been timely dealt with by a franchisee as required by regulations the city shall have the authority to investigate complaints of subscribers and nonsubscribers franchisee shall maintain a complete file of all written complaints made during the immediately preceding two years attached to each complaint shall be an appropriate written document showing the disposition or satisfaction thereof this file is subject to review by the city the city manager may establish procedures for the speedy resolution of such complaints  101706 renewal or renegotiation of franchise  opt into federal or state video franchising a renewal process shall be in compliance with applicable law b if renewal of a franchise is denied and the city does not purchase the cable system or otherwise effect a transfer the city may require the former franchisee to remove its facilities and equipment if the former franchisee fails to do so within a reasonable period of time the city may have the removal done at the former franchisees andor suretys expense c should any change in federal or state law occurring during the term of any franchise agreement have the lawful effect of materially altering the regime of cable franchising then any franchisee shall have the option of terminating any franchise agreement in order to opt into such new regime alternatively in the event of a material change in federal or state laws or federal communications commission rules the city and a franchisee may mutually agree to renegotiate those particular terms of the franchise affected by changes in said laws or ruless any franchise agreement and this article shall remain in full force and effect 1 until a change in law materially alters the regime of cable franchising allowing franchisees to opt to terminate  or 2 until any negotiated amendments to the franchise agreement and if applicable this article have been duly approved by both the city and a franchisee  101706 city rights a subject to section 2790a the city reserves the right to further amend this article or adopt additional ordinances if it finds it necessary to protect the public health safety and welfare b in the event that the federal government or any other governmental agency allows the city to exercise powers which the city does not have with respect to rates and other matters at the time a franchise is granted under this article the city reserves the right to exercise those powers c during the term of a franchise the city may where aerial construction exists maintain freeofcharge upon any poles owned by the franchisee wire and pole fixtures necessary for the provision of a police andor fire alarm system and emergency medical services so long as such fixtures shall not interfere with franchisees operation of its cable system such wires and fixtures shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with all applicable safety standards and laws d the city may inspect all construction or installation work in the rights of way during such construction or installation or at any time after completion thereof in order to ensure compliance with the provisions of this article and all other governing ordinances or laws  101706 franchisee rules a franchisee may promulgate such rules regulations terms and conditions governing the conduct of its business as shall be reasonably necessary to enable the franchisee to exercise its rights and perform its obligations under the franchise and to assure uninterrupted service to all its subscribers however such rules regulations terms and conditions shall not be in conflict with the provisions of this article other city ordinances or state or federal statutes  101706 performance bond any franchise agreement with the city shall require the franchisee to maintain throughout the term of the franchise or any renewal or extension thereof a faithful performance bond running to the city with one good and sufficient surety approved by the city or some other type of security acceptable to the city which acceptance shall not be unreasonably denied the bond shall be conditioned upon the faithful performance of the franchisee and upon the further condition that in the event the franchisee shall fail to comply with any law ordinance or regulation governing the franchise there shall be recoverable jointly and severally from the principal and the surety of the bond any damage or loss suffered by the city as a result including the full amount of any compensation indemnification or cost of removal or abandonment of any property of the franchisee plus an allowance for attorneys fees and costs up to the full amount of the bond  101706 security fund a prior to a franchise becoming effective the franchisee may have to post with the city a cash security deposit or an irrevocable letter of credit in an amount specified in a franchise agreement to be used as a security fund to ensure the faithful performance of all provisions of law and the franchise agreement and compliance with all orders permits and directions of the city and the payment by the franchisee of any claims liens or taxes due the city which arise by reason of the construction operation or maintenance of the system the security deposit shall be in the amount a franchise agreement specifies taking into account the effects of inflation and the extent of the franchisees operations in the city if the franchisee does not post the amount within 30 calendar days after the franchise agreement is signed the entire security fund remaining may be forfeited if the city can prove damages andor such failure may be considered a material breach of this article and may be used as grounds for revocation of the franchise consistent with the procedures set forth herein b following the revocation and termination of a franchise the franchisee is entitled to the return of that portion of the security fund that remains provided that there is no outstanding default or unpaid amounts owed to the city by the franchisee any such unpaid amounts due the city shall be withdrawn from the security fund prior to its release c rights reserved to the city with respect to the security fund are in addition to all other rights of the city whether reserved by this article or authorized by other law  and no action proceeding or exercise of a right with respect to such security fund will affect any other right the city may have  101706 subscriber privacy a franchisee shall protect the privacy of all subscribers pursuant to the provisions of of the cable act 47 usc  551 a franchisee shall not condition subscriber service on the subscribers grant of permission to disclose information which pursuant to federal law cannot be disclosed without the subscribers explicit consent  101706 technical standards a any cable system constructed within the city shall meet requirements established by the fcc b all construction installation and maintenance must comply with the national electrical safety the national electric all state and local regulations and good and accepted industry practices c the franchisee must perform at its expense proof of performance tests as required by the fcc regulations the franchisee must provide the proof of performance test results promptly to the city upon request the city shall have the right to inspect the cable system facilities during and after their construction to ensure compliance with the requirements of the franchise agreement and this article provided the city gives franchisee reasonable notice a representative from franchisee is present and such inspection does not interfere with the operation of the system d consistent with fcc rules an annual proof of performance or other tests shall be performed at the expense of the franchisee the franchisee must provide test results promptly to the city upon request e upon request a franchisee must advise the city when a proof of performance test required in subsections c and d above is scheduled so that the city may have an observer present f a franchisee must not design install or operate its facilities in a manner that will interfere with the signals of any broadcast station the electrical system located in any building the cable system of another franchisee or individual or master antennas used for receiving television or other broadcast signals in violation of applicable law  101706 enforcement remedies a the city has the right to apply any one or combination of the following remedies in the event a franchisee violates any material provision of the law this article or its franchise agreement 1 impose liquidated damages in such amount on a per day incident or other measure of violation basis pursuant to the procedures of this article violations listed in section 2784 shall be considered material breaches of this article
