evaluate the assertion and render a written decision in a timely manner relative to the assertion the decision of the city manager shall be final and appeal therefrom may be filed in a court of competent jurisdiction  31400   32001   5404   22106 vehicles on roads or streets within city  action by law enforcement officer a definitions the terms used in this section shall unless otherwise specified be defined as set forth in f s ch 316 as amended b upon any road or street inside the city no person shall stop park or leave standing any vehicle whether attended or unattended upon the paved or maintraveled part of the road or street when it is practical to stop park or so leave the vehicle off such part of the road or street  but in any event an unobstructed width of the road or street opposite a standing vehicle shall be left for the free passage of other vehicles and a clear view of the stopped vehicle shall be available from a distance of 200 feet in each direction upon the road or street c this section shall not apply to the driver or owner of any vehicle which is disabled while on the paved or maintraveled part of a road or street in such a manner and to such extent that it is impossible to avoid stopping and temporarily leaving the disabled vehicle in such position or to passengercarrying buses temporarily parked while loading or discharging passengers where road or street conditions render such parking off the paved portion of the road or street hazardous or impractical d whenever any law enforcement officer finds a vehicle standing upon a road or street in violation of any of the foregoing provisions of this section the officer is authorized to move the vehicle or require the driver or other persons in charge of the vehicle to move the same to a position off the paved or maintraveled part of the road or street e officers are hereby authorized to provide for the removal of any abandoned vehicle to the nearest garage or other place of safety cost of such removal and storage to be a lien against the motor vehicle when the abandoned vehicle is found unattended upon a bridge or causeway or on any public road or street in the following instances 1 where such vehicle constitutes an obstruction of traffic  2 where such vehicle has been parked or stored on the public rightofway for a period exceeding 48 hours in other than designated parking areas and is within 30 feet of the pavement edge  3 where a vehicle has been parked or stored in the public rightofway for a period exceeding ten days in other than designated parking areas and is more than 30 feet from the pavement edge f whenever any law enforcement officer receives a report of or finds a vehicle that is without a current license tag or inspection sticker standing on the public rightofway the owner will be notified to remove the vehicle after 24 hours the officer will treat it as an abandoned vehicle and remove it immediately  2 32001 parking prohibited for certain purposes no person shall park a vehicle upon any road or street or rightofway for the principal purpose of 1 displaying such vehicle for sale 2 washing greasing or repairing such vehicle except repairs necessary in an emergency 3 displaying advertising 4 selling merchandise from such vehicle except in a duly established marketplace or when so authorized or licensed under the ordinance of the city 5 storage or as junkage or dead storage for more than 24 hours  32001 parking prohibited in certain areas a notwithstanding the provisions of any other ordinance provision in order to implement the provision of fs  1a which permits local authorities to regulate with respect to streets and road or streets under their jurisdiction in order to provide for the reasonable exercise of the police power and to prohibit or regulate the stopping standing or parking of motor vehicles on said streets and road or streets parking on rightsofway within the city is prohibited whenever the rightofway is posted with a sign designating the area as a no parking area the citys public works director is hereby delegated the power and authority to post areas as no parking areas for motor vehicles when such areas are deemed to present either safety hazards to the traveling public which cause adverse impacts to roadway or rightofway or which are otherwise deleterious to and jeopardize the public health safety or welfare the city manager and the city council shall be advised when such areas are posted b it is unlawful to park a motor vehicle on a street or road or street that is posted in accordance with the provisions of subsection a of this section c it shall be unlawful for any person to park stop or stand a vehicle in any parking space designated in accordance with the provisions of fs ch 316 for use only by the disabled unless the vehicle displays a parking permit issued pursuant to fs   or   and such vehicle is transporting a person eligible for such parking permit any person who is chauffeuring a disabled person shall be allowed without need for an identification parking permit momentary parking in such parking space for the purpose of loading or unloading a disabled person and no penalty shall be imposed upon the driver for such momentary parking d penalty  any person who directly or indirectly violates the provisions of this section shall be guilty of a nonmoving violation and in accordance with fs   shall be subject to a fine of $10000 or as otherwise designated in section 2227 for each offense  2 82101   1 8718 enforcement of parking violations any civil citation relating to parking violations set forth in the ordinances of the city of palm coast may be referred by the city to the civil traffic infractions hearing officer for flagler county florida and the violation will thereupon be enforced and disposed of in accordance with the general state law applicable to citations  9506 article iii  speed limits and speed zones division 1  speed limits establishment of speed limits  speed zones a thirtyfive miles per hour the speed limit is hereby established at 35 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed club house drive b forty miles per hour the speed limit is hereby established at 40 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed east hampton boulevard c fortyfive miles per hour the speed limit is hereby established at 45 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed rymfire drive sesame boulevard  21704 division 2  belle terre parkway legislative findings and purposes of the division a the purpose of this division is to 1 provide for the acceptance of the study dated july 200 conducted by the engineering firms of cph and traffic planning & design inc entitled speed zoning study belle terre parkway palm coast florida 2 provide for the future acceptance of speed zone and speed limit studies by the city manager after consultation with the city engineer when such studies have been prepared by registered engineers who are qualified to conduct such studies 3 provide for the establishment of speed limits and speed zones for various segments of belle terre parkway 4 delegate the authority to establish speed zones and speed limits to the city manager after consulting with the city engineer 5 provide a model for the process and procedures relating to the acceptance of speed zones and speed limit studies and the establishment of speed zones and speed limits by the city manager b the recitals to this division whereas clauses are hereby adopted as additional legislative findings  12302 acceptance of belle terre parkway study a the study dated july 200 conducted by the engineering firms of cph and traffic planning & design inc entitled speed zoning study belle terre parkway palm coast florida is hereby accepted by the city council of the city of palm coast b establishment of speed limitsspeed zonesbelle terre parkway 1 the speed limit for the segment of belle terre parkway between matanzas woods parkway to burroughs drive is hereby established at 45 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed 2 the speed limit for the segment of belle terre parkway between burroughs drive and palm cost parkway is hereby established at 45 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed 3 the speed limit for the segment of belle terre parkway between palm coast parkway to parkview drive is hereby established at 45 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed 4 the speed limit for the segment of belle terre parkway between parkview drive to white view parkway is hereby established at 45 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed 5 the speed limit for the segment of belle terre parkway between white view parkway to royal palms parkway is hereby established at 45 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed 6 the speed limit for the segment of belle terre parkway between royal palms parkway to state road 100 moody boulevard is hereby established at 45 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed 7 the speed limit for the segment of belle terre parkway between state road 100 moody boulevard to united states highway 1 is hereby established at 50 miles per hour and it is unlawful to drive a motor vehicle at a rate in excess of such speed  3 12302 conflicts a florida statutes known as the florida uniform traffic control law is applicable in the city of palm coast florida and supersedes this division in the event of any irreconcilable conflict  12302 article iv  vehicles for hire legislative purpose the legislative purpose of this article is to regulate the vehicles for hire business within the city in order to preserve the health safety morals and welfare of the citizens and visitors of the city and the protection of their property and to promote safe reliable and economically viable vehicles for hire service within the city the use of a passenger vehicle for hire shall be presumed to be the use of a vehicle for hire  7505 definitions the following words and phrases when used in this article shall have the following meanings except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning automobile means a four door fullsized passenger vehicle capable of seating four to six adults cause to be operated means a person who either i provides lease or nonlease vehicles to a driver to be used or operated as a vehicle for hire or ii operates a vehicle for hire as a single unit permittee or iii operates a central dispatch for one or more vehicles for hire city means the city of palm coast florida city council means the city council of the city compensation means any fare reward tip donation or other thing of value which a driver or owner of a vehicle accepts or receives or offers to accept or receive in return for furnishing such service driver means any person operating or in charge of a vehicle for hire driver permit means a permit issued pursuant to this article which entitles a person to drive or operate a vehicle for hire within the jurisdictional limits of the city employee means any manager dispatcher mechanic driver contract driver agent or other individual who is compensated by a certificate holder in the conduct of its business limousine means a luxury sedan or luxury van or a motor vehicle that is a chauffeurdriven passenger vehicle which has been built or modifiedforthepurpose as a limousine on an automobile chassis of a luxury sedan eg formal or extended limousine manifest means the daily record prepared by the driver for the vehicle for hire that he or she operates meter or taxicab meter means any mechanical digital or electronic device which services and monitors the distance time and mileage to determine the fare to be charged a passenger of a vehicle for hire motor vehicle means a vehicle that is motorized or selfpropelled by power other than muscular power or by animals but does not include traction engines road rollers bicycles mopeds or motorcycles operate or operation means providing vehicle for hire services by the i vehicle driver or ii vehicle permit holder owner means the person to whom a certificate has been issued passenger vehicle means a motor vehicle used for the transportation of persons permit means the permit issued pursuant to this article which grants the privilege to operate as a vehicle for hire service or a driver within the jurisdictional limits or upon the public roadways of the city permit holder means any person who holds a permit for the operation of any category of vehicle for hire within the jurisdictional limits of or upon the public roadways of the city for purposes of interpretation within this article the term permit holder includes any agent employee or any person acting with the permit holders knowledge consent or permission whether express or implied the term permit holder also includes a taxicab permit holder person means an individual firm partnership corporation or association however organized and by whatever name and existing in whatever form prior calendar period or prior period means span of time from the last calendar year january 1 to december 31 in which new permits were issued calendar year immediately preceding the current calendar year scheduled means the transportation of persons on predetermined points of origin destination or schedules of service scheduled service means operating on a time schedule andor a fixed route services are typically prearranged and presold which means prior to the arrival of the passenger at the place of origin for the vehicle trip the driver and the vehicle shall remain with the hiring party during the period for which the driver and the vehicle have been hired shuttle service means a chauffeurdriven passenger vehicle providing scheduled vehicle for hire services statistical metropolitan area sma means all of the land area within the city limits of the city taxicab means any vehicle for hire that solicits to carry attempts to pick up or picks up one or more persons for transportation from one place to another for a fee this term excludes buses with seating capacities of 16 or more passengers including the driver operating upon fixed routes and between fixed termini this term also excludes charter services or limousine services the terms taxicab taxi and cab are synonymous evidence of intent to operate as a taxicab may include but is not limited to markings on a vehicle or sign beckoning from or near a vehicle to pedestrians or parking or stopping in a marked taxi stand unsafe means that the condition of the vehicle whether a major violation or defect or an aggregate of minor defects could reasonably pose a safety or health risk to the traveling public van means a passenger vehicle recognized as either a minivan fullsize passenger van or a passenger vehicle on a van or truck chassis the term shall not include a cargo or panel van vehicle for hire means any passenger vehicle engaged in the transportation of persons from or entirely within the city limits of the city with the intent to receive direct or indirect compensation for providing such transportation vehicle for hire administrator means the person who has been designated by the city manager to administer enforce regulate and interpret the provisions of this article  7505 administration a the city manager shall designate a vehicle for hire administrator who shall administer enforce regulate and interpret the provisions of this article b the vehicle for hire administrator shall have the powers and duties set forth in this article under the direction of the city manager c the vehicle for hire administrator after consultation with the city attorney as needed shall interpret the provisions of this article upon application and payment of any fee established interpretations may be in writing upon request of an affected person d decisions made pursuant to and interpretations of this article by the vehicle for hire administrator shall be binding an affected person may appeal a decision or an interpretation to the city manager for a de novo review upon application and payment of any fee established by resolution of the city council  7505 vehicle registration  classifications  requirements a any vehicle for hire operated caused to be operated or driven with the intent to pick up passengers originate oneway transportation or provide return service for a roundtrip transportation within the jurisdictional limits of or upon the public streets of the city shall be subject to the regulations restrictions and conditions set forth in this article b the following categories of vehicles for hire shall be exempt from the provisions of this article 1 ambulances licensed by the state of florida  2 hearses operated or limited exclusively to use by a licensed mortician  3 passenger vehicles seating more than 20 persons that are not used for a transportation related commercial purpose  4 passenger vehicles owned operated leased or controlled by a governmental agency  5 shuttle services using a van owned and operated directly by a hotel or motel for transportation limited to registered guests thereof it shall be presumed that this exemption is not applicable if the van does not bear any advertising or identification of the hotel or motel  6 exclusive ridesharing vehicles as defined in 9 florida statutes as amended  7 school buses subject to the provisions of chapters 234 and 316 florida statutes as amended  8 vehicle for hire services provided that the vehicles used to provide such services shall be clearly and distinctively marked as disadvantaged transportation  and provided further that any of the vehicles used to provide disadvantaged transportation shall be operated by a driver holding a driver permit providing for transportation services a as outlined in 2 florida statutes to the transportation disadvantaged as defined in 1 florida statutes as amended  or b by a transportation operator as defined in 6 florida statutes as amended  or c pursuant to a contract authorized in florida statutes as amended with the community transportation coordinator as defined in 5 florida statutes which contract is on file with the vehicle for hire administrator  9 transportation services operated a as a bonafide tour company by a seller of travel as defined in florida statutes as amended or b operated by a person who as determined in writing by the vehicle for hire administrator provides the vehicle for hire service to the passengers as an ancillary part of a primary scheduled service or tour 10 the single motor vehicle independent contractor who operates without connection with any other driver association of drivers or any entity of whatsoever type or nature providing transportation services in the nature of a vehicle for hire however such operators shall be registered with the city and pay the established registration fee c every vehicle for hire permitted pursuant to this article shall be classified according to one of the following categories 1 taxicab  2 limousine  or 3 shuttle service d the applicant for a permit shall request the particular category on the application for a vehicle permit submitted the classification shall be made by the vehicle for hire administrator e the purposes of the classifications are to 1 ensure that different forms of vehicle for hire service are recognized  2 avoid misleading information or creating confusion among the traveling public  and 3 provide notice to the permit holder of the classification and the applicable limitations and regulations pertaining to the category f vehicle for hire permit holders shall only provide the services specified below 1 a permit holder in the taxicab classification may only a provide general transportation of persons not on regular schedules with the routes traveled or the destination determined by the passengers  b provide good and reasonable service at all times to all parts of the city 24 hours a day each and every day of the year unless prevented by a labor strike or an act of god  c maintain a business office with sufficient employees to answer all calls 24 hours a day each and every day of the year  d base the fare charged to the passenger on the use of the vehicle without regard to the number of passengers carried  e determine the fare by a meter  and f provide the taxicab service in an automobile station wagon or van that is capable of comfortably seating at least four adult passengers and the driver and a maximum of nine adult passengers 2 a permit holder in the limousine classification may provide the transportation of persons as follows a limited to a limousine luxury sedan or luxury van  b leased rented or charged upon for a minimum time period of one hour 60 minutes  c with the fare determined on an hourly basis and not by a meter or mileage for the use of the vehicle  and d prearranged or arranged third party eg guest service desk or concierge desk 3 a permit holder in the shuttle service classification may provide the transportation of persons as follows a limited to a van  b on a scheduled service  c with the fare determined on a per capita basis and not by a meter or mileage  and d prearranged or arranged third party eg guest service desk or concierge desk g each permit holder shall strictly comply with the regulations and requirements for the particular category of a vehicle for hire as outlined in this article  7505 permit application and permit procedure for vehicleforhire services a an application for a permit shall be filed with the vehicle for hire administrator with an application fee established by resolution of the city council the application fee shall not apply to renewal or additional permit applications which shall be subject to additional fees b the application shall contain at a minimum the following information 1 the name of the applicant  2 the name of the applicants business and trade name under which the business will operate and a copy of proof of payment or occupational license taxes  3 if the business is a partnership whether general or limited the partnership instrument or certified copy thereof and the business address of the partnership  4 if the business is a corporation the certificate of incorporation or certified copies thereof and the business address of the corporation  5 if the business is to be conducted under another name than that of the applicant a copy of the fictitious name certificate if required  6 the applicants business location  7 the applicants business mailing address  8 the applicants business phone number  9 the applicants home address and home phone number  10 the category of permit requested  11 the seating capacity make model year of manufacture mileage equipment and amenities for each vehicle to be used  12 the color scheme of the vehicles the applicant intends to operate  13 the type and make of radios or communication devices the applicant will be using in the vehicles  14 the names and addresses of any and all persons holding a ten percent or greater beneficial interest in the applicants business or company  15 the date the application is filed with the vehicle for hire administrator  16 the names addresses and telephone numbers of at least three references from persons not related to the applicant who have knowledge of the applicant  17 a proposal for submission of appropriate insurance coverage or proof of coverage  18 if applicable a proposed agreement with telephone directoryies that is distributed within the entire corporate limits of the city indicating required advertising and the telephone number which will be used by customers to contact the business for service  19 a factual statement and documentation indicating the portions of the vehicle for hire market to be served and such other pertinent information as the applicant may desire to present  20 any other information required as deemed appropriate by the vehicle for hire administrator of any applicant for the particular classification of vehicle for hire service the additional requirements shall be consistent with the provisions of this article c within three business days after receipt of an application and payment of the application fee the vehicle for hire administrator shall review the application to ensure that the application is complete and all information required has been provided the vehicle for hire administrator shall with the completeness review categorize the vehicle for hire service in the appropriate classification permits shall be issued or denied within 15 days after the date of completeness determination failure to disclose any person holding an interest in the proposed permit shall be grounds for the rejection of the application d in making a determination as to whether the permit will be issued to the applicant the vehicle for hire administrator shall consider the following criteria 1 completeness of the application as required by this article  2 completeness of the application support documentation as required by this article  3 whether the color scheme logo trade name and exterior design are sufficiently unique from any other permit holder as to prevent confusion for the riding public and infringement of an existing permit holders color scheme logo trade name and exterior design  4 verification of references  and 5 the applicants experience in operating a vehicle for hire or in operating a vehicle for hire business e in addition to other requirements set forth in this article the following criteria shall apply for the issuance of additional permits to an existing permit holder 1 adherence of the permit holder and its drivers to the provisions of this article other applicable ordinances of the city and of the the city of palm coast  2 whether or not the requirements for issuance of any initial permit as described in this article continue to be met  3 any evidence received from citizen complaints or the city as to the quality of service provided by the permit holder and its drivers and compliance with the provisions of this article  4 trip reports and business records of the permit holder and its drivers  and 5 any other relevant or pertinent information from either the general public or the city f if after review of the application the vehicle for hire administrator finds that the applicant does not meet the application requirements the vehicle for hire administrator shall deny the application the denial may be 1 conditional and affording the applicant an opportunity to provide further information or take other action which may result in approval of the applicant by the vehicle for hire administrator  or 2 final g upon a determination that a permit shall be issued the vehicle for hire administrator shall issue the permit upon submission of the following documents 1 insurance certification proving that the applicant has met the insurance requirements  2 vehicle inspection certification from an inspection facility as designated by the city council certifying that the vehicles to be permitted meets the safety and equipment a requirement of this article  provided however any person or company holding permits for 25 vehicles or more and operating a facility for maintaining and repairing said vehicles and such inspections are performed by ase automotive service excellence certified mechanics may conduct the safety inspections of those vehicles as required by this article all permit holders qualifying as self inspectors must be in compliance with the ase requirements said certification shall have been issued not more than 30 days prior to the issuance of the permit this requirement may be waived for any vehicle with a manufacture date that is less than 365 days from the date such permit is to be issued and which has less than 10000 miles in mileage the vehicle for hire administrator or designee shall conduct at no cost an inspection of such vehicle to determine compliance with requirements such as a doing business as tag and twoway communication device  3 if required a receipt or certified copy from applicable telephone carriers for advertisement in the upcoming yellow pages  4 submission of every vehicle identification number state license plate number mileage and the original or copy of the state of florida registration  and 5 proof of payment of occupational license taxes h prior to issuance of the vehicle permits by the vehicle for hire administrator the applicant shall pay a permit fee for each permit established by resolution of the city council i permits shall be valid for one year until the last day of the month in which the permit was issued the year prior j permits shall be issued for the classification approved by the vehicle for hire administrator k the permit decal for the permit shall be affixed to each vehicle for hire in a manner determined by the vehicle for hire administrator l each permit holder shall maintain in active operation each vehicle for which the permit was issued any permit which remains dormant for more than 90 consecutive days or 150 days in any calendar year may be revoked and declared void by the vehicle for hire administrator m a permit issued renewed awarded or transferred herein shall not vest the permit holder with any property rights in said permit n sixty days prior to the expiration of a permit the permit holder may renew the permit for an additional 12month term by submitting an application for renewal to the vehicle for hire administrator the renewal application shall contain the same information as the original application the vehicle for hire administrator shall review each application and within ten days of the receipt of a completed application either approve or deny the application upon approval of the renewal permit the renewal permit shall be issued upon the payment of a fee established by resolution of the city council permit holders who renew a permit after the expiration date shall be assessed a late fee established by resolution of the city council permit renewals after 30 days shall be processed as an additional permit request a late renewal of permit shall be presumptive evidence of operating without a permit o if a decal for the permit is lost or destroyed or a replacement decal is requested the permit holder may obtain a duplicate decal upon the payment of a service charge established by resolution of the city council it is prohibited and unlawful for any person to place or cause another to place a permit decal on any vehicle other than that vehicle to which the permit decal was assigned p the transfer from one permit holder to another shall not be effective until the transfer permit has been issued by the vehicle for hire administrator the transfer of a permit to a person who is not a current permit holder licensed herein shall not be effective until the proposed transfereeassignee submits an application pays the application fees and obtains approval q it is prohibited and unlawful for a permit holder to sell bargain grant demise lease option or assign hereinafter collectively transfer a permit except as provided for in this article any attempted transfer of any permit not provided for in this article shall result in an automatic revocation of the permit r any permit holder may lease or contract for dispatch and vehicle maintenance services with another permit holder a permit holder leasing dispatch or vehicle maintenance services from another permit holder must operate under the color scheme of the permit holder that is providing the leased services  7505 driver permits a any person who operates or drives a vehicle for hire within the city of or upon any street in the city shall first obtain a driver permit as set forth in this article b any person being 18 years of age or older may make application to the city for a driver permit the application shall include at a minimum the following items 1 applicants name date of birth social security number sex race or national origin and any aliases or former legal names used during the preceding fiveyear period  2 applicants home address and mailing address as well as email addresses  3 applicants home phone number cellular telephone number and existing work phone number  4 proof that the applicant holds a valid florida drivers license  5 the names addresses and phone numbers of the applicants existing employer and any other employer during the preceding three years  6 the addresses of each and every place of residence or domicile of the applicant during the preceding three years  7 two photographs of the applicant of the size and type as determined by the city  8 a sworn affidavit by the applicant which states that the applicant has not been convicted of within the past five years or heshe does not have any charges pending against himher for any of the following crimes a driving under the influence of drugs or alcohol b vehicular manslaughter c reckless driving d murder manslaughter armed robbery assault with a deadly weapon or aggravated assault e any crime which is designated as a felony f any crime involving the sale or possession of a controlled substances as defined by florida statutes g the florida rico act h exposure of the sexual organs and any crime defined under florida statutes or i any crime defined as prostitution under florida statutes including but not limited to assignation or solicitation for prostitution 9 the name address and phone number of the permit holder for vehicle for hire services for which the applicant is working or intends to work  10 such other information as the city may require of all applicants including but not limited to a florida department of law enforcement inquiry  11 payment of an application fee established by resolution of the city council c upon receipt of an application and evidence of the payment of the application fee the vehicle for hire administrator shall review the application to ensure that the application is complete and all information requested has been provided the vehicle for hire administrator shall determine whether the applicant understands and is reasonably conversant in the english language for the demands of a driver and the requirements of this article d if the application is deemed complete by the vehicle for hire administrator and the applicant successfully shows that heshe is reasonably conversant in the english language then the application and the affidavits shall be verified for accuracy by the vehicle for hire administrator e a drivers permit shall not be issued if within the last five years immediately preceding the application the applicant has been convicted of or has pending charges for any of the following 1 driving under the influence of drugs or alcohol 2 vehicular manslaughter 3 reckless driving 4 murder manslaughter armed robbery assault with a deadly weapon or aggravated assault 5 any crime which is designated as a felony 6 any crime involving the sale or possession of controlled substances as defined by florida statutes 7 the florida rico act 8 exposure of the sexual organs and any crime defined under florida statutes or 9 any crime defined as prostitution under florida statutes including but not limited to assignation or solicitation for prostitution f the applicant shall have the burden of proof to show by substantial competent evidence that the applicant has been reformed rehabilitated and without any reasonable doubt does not pose a safety risk to members of the traveling public substantial competent evidence shall not include testimony of the applicant without verification by independent sources such as employment records parole records evidence of completion of drug andor alcohol rehabilitation and testimony of third parties ten days prior to the hearing the applicant shall provide a list of the evidence and witnesses to the vehicle for hire administrator failure to list the evidence or witnesses shall bar the submission of the unlisted evidence or witnesses to the city g if after review of the application the vehicle for hire administrator finds that the applicant does not meet the application requirements the vehicle for hire administrator shall deny the application the denial may be 1 conditional and affording the applicant an opportunity to provide further information or take other action which may result in approval of the applicant by the vehicle for hire administrator  or 2 final h each driver permit issued shall bear the drivers name photograph permit number and expiration date the city shall maintain a photograph of the driver on file i every driver shall have hisher permit visibly displayed on the exterior of the drivers blouse or shirt or in any vehicle operated at all times when on duty and shall produce it upon demand of any passenger city code enforcement officer or administrator or city county or state law enforcement officer j driver permits shall be valid for a period of three years from the date of issuance k if any of the information supplied by the driver in the application is no longer accurate the driver shall then provide current and accurate information to city within 30 days of the date the change occurs the information filed with the vehicle for hire administrator or designee shall be assumed correct and exclusively relied upon as the correct address for all notices and enforcement proceedings herein failure to maintain the accuracy of the application information on file shall result in automatic suspension of said permit unless otherwise prohibited by this article the city any other applicable law rule or regulation no driver shall refuse any request for transportation from any orderly passenger where the destination of the trip is within the flagler county area any driver may request or demand advance payment prior to commencement of a trip and refuse to initiate such trip and may terminate a trip andor may request payment if the driver has reason to believe the passengers may cause bodily injury to himher or the passengers become unruly rowdy or cause physical damage to the vehicle or the driver  7505 safety and equipment standards a every vehicle for hire shall meet the following minimum safety and equipment standards 1 tires shall be of the size appropriate for the vehicle for hire and with no mismatched tires there shall be no cuts into the tire cord or sidewall area or localized worn spots that expose the ply no tire is permitted with less than twothirty second  232  inches remaining when measured in any two grooves at three equally spaced intervals around the circumference of the tire or when the tire has tread wear indicators that are visible 2 the vehicle for hire shall be equipped with an operational horn with the actuating button mounted in the location designated by the vehicle manufacturer and operated in the manner designed and assembled by the vehicle manufacturer 3 the windshield side and rear windows shall operate as designed and be assembled with no breakage cracks or pits that may impair visibility or hinder the safety of passengers it is prohibited and unlawful for any windows on a vehicle for hire to be composed of covered by or treated with any material which would cause the vehicle to be in violation of florida statutes 4 all doors must have operating handles that allow opening from the inside and outside handles knobs and armrests shall be free of breaks and must be securely mounted door hinges and hold stops shall function correctly door seals and gaskets shall be intact and operating to seal water and odors from entering the passenger compartment from outside all door panels shall be intact to prevent accidental injuries on door and window mechanisms 5 the interior condition of each vehicle for hire shall comply with the following a all standard interior equipment shall be complete and intact including but not limited to interior lights headliner dashboard head rests window cranks and gear shifts b seat covers shall be permanently attached or fixed to all seats in the vehicle for hire and shall have no exposed wire or sharp edges either from metal or hardened vinyl the rear seat shall be of a type size and mounting approved by the vehicle manufacturer broken springs sagging or horizontal slippage in any seat are prohibited and unlawful c floor covering material shall be secure and contain no rips or loose folds the floor board of the vehicle for hire shall be free of rust and holes d loose or moving objects or externally mounted speakers shall not be placed on the deck behind the rear seat or on the front dash board decorations or other objects hanging from permanently mounted fixtures in a vehicle for hire 6 each vehicle for hire shall have seat belts available for passengers in all seats except jump seats spaces designed to accommodate wheelchairs or where the seat belts are not required by law seat belts shall be provided in good and effectual operating condition and easily accessible by all passengers seat belts shall be clean and free of grease and other objectionable substances seat belts which are placed under the seat or between the lower and upper portions of the seat are hereby conclusively deemed not easily accessible 7 each vehicle for hire shall have standard operational windshield wipers for the entire front windshield which shall be controlled electronically or by vacuum and operated from the interior of the vehicle for hire the wiper blades shall be in such a condition as to make firm contact with the windshield when operational and shall not be torn or badly worn 8 each vehicle for hire shall contain an operational parking brake and a primary brake system which acts effectively on all four vehicle wheels there shall be no visible leaks in the brake line wheel cylinder or any part of the brake system and no frayed cables all primary brake systems shall demonstrate a reasonable and safe total braking force when tested using the quick stop method and with the vehicle for hire operating at a speed of at least 20 miles per hour brake linings and disc pads when measured at the thinnest point shall not be less than onesixteenth of an inch brake linings andor pads shall be firmly attached to the brake shoe andor disk coupler disc brake rotors and brake drums shall be of a size and type appropriate for the vehicle with no cracks or other damage which change or impair the functional surface 9 every vehicle for hire shall be equipped with operational state of floridaapproved headlights and turn indicating lamps or devices on the front and rear of the vehicle and a foot brake activated stop light on the rear of the vehicle each vehicle for hire shall have a tail lamp so situated on the vehicle as to illuminate the rear license plate with a white light and render it clearly legible 10 steering mechanisms shall neither be worn or jammed nor shall there be more than two inches play to the left or right of center measured at the steering wheel rim with the road wheels in a straight ahead position on wheels up to 18 inches in diameter or three inches of play on wheels over 18 inches 11 there shall be no leakage of exhaust gas at the manifold gasket manifold and exhaust line gasket muffler and muffler connections or at any other point in the exhaust system as determined visual and audible inspection the tail pipe shall discharge exhaust from the rear or sides of the passenger and luggage compartment it is prohibited and unlawful for any part of the exhaust system to pass leak into the part of the vehicle for hire occupied by passengers as determined by visual inspection 12 every vehicle for hire shall be equipped with an adequately operating air conditioning and heating system and windshield defrost or defogging system which controls the temperature of the interior of the vehicle between 68f to 78f 13 every vehicle for hire permit holder shall repair or replace any equipment or parts of the vehicle found to be worn out defective or creating a safety hazard by the vehicle inspection facility as a result of the inspection 14 every taxicab shall be equipped with a taxicab meter or meter for registering the fare to be charged each taxicab meter shall be inspected approved and sealed pursuant to florida statutes  7505 meters a every meter in use shall be placed in the taxicab at a location that will be plainly visible at all times to the passengers of the taxicab between the hours of sunset and sunrise the dial of the meter shall be illuminated whenever the ignition of the vehicle is on b whenever a taxicab is not hired the meter shall show no fare when a taxicab is hired the meter shall be in the calculating position upon the completion of service by a taxicab the meter shall be returned to the noncalculating position and its dial cleared c it shall be the duty of the taxicab permit holder to have the meter in good working condition and operating accurately as to the registration of mileage and fare meters shall be sealed in a manner that will prevent any person from tampering with or changing the adjustment of the meter d it is prohibited and unlawful for any category of vehicle for hire except a taxicab to be equipped have installed or possess within its interior a taxicab meter whether or not the meter is in operation  7505 communication devices a all vehicles for hire shall be equipped with either cellular telephones or reliable and accessible communications systems such that office dispatchers may immediately and effectively notify drivers of requests for service in order that drivers may immediately and effectively request assistance should assistance be needed b any electrical device such as radar detectorsfuzz busters police twoway or similar scanners or twoway radio frequency monitors are prohibited and unlawful to be located within a vehicle for hire or in the possession of a driver handcarried amfm radios televisions or other similar entertainment musical devices are allowed c it is prohibited and unlawful for a permit holder to possess at its place of business dispatch operation or in any building or vehicle for hire any device used for the monitoring of a competitors radio frequency  7505 liability insurance or surety bond a each permit holder shall possess a liability and property damage insurance policy issued by an insurance company or surety company who is authorized to do business in the state of florida or who has a current license under federal law as a risk retention group for purposes of insurance b the coverage for each vehicle equipped to carry six or fewer passengers including the driver shall be maintained at a minimum in the following amounts 1 one hundred thousand dollars for injuries per person in any one occurrence or accident and $30000000 per occurrence or accident  and 2 an amount of not less than $5000000 for property damage in any one accident c the coverage for each vehicle equipped to carry seven or more passengers including the driver shall be issued in the amount of $100000000 combined single incident or its equivalent any separate policy acquired in order to achieve the higher level of coverage must have the same expiration date as the main policy d each insurance policy shall list the city as an additional insured with all notices of any kind including but not limited to termination cancellation reduction in coverage renewal or nonrenewal sent to the city at the address of the vehicle for hire administrator the insurance policy shall contain at a minimum a 30 day written notice period prior to the effective date of termination cancellation reduction of coverage renewal or nonrenewal e all vehicle permits issued to a vehicle permit holder shall be covered under one master policy held by that permit holder f a permit holder may selfinsure for the insurance requirements if 1 the permit holder is certified for financial responsibility as a selfinsurer and is current in standing with the insurance licensing offices of the state of florida  2 the retention of exposure by the vehicle permit holder is no greater than allowed by the controlling provisions of the florida statutes  and 3 the excess policies at a minimum satisfy the policy limits listed in paragraph 1 above g no policy of required insurance shall be canceled until the expiration of 30 days after notice of intended cancellation thereof has been given in writing to the vehicle for hire administrator by mail or personal delivery of such notice h should a vehicle for hire at any time cease to be covered by a policy of insurance as required by this article the vehicle permit shall be automatically suspended without the need for any action of the city and may only be reinstated in accordance with this article  7505 trade name and color scheme a every permit holder shall operate under a trade name which is distinctive from and not substantially similar to any existing business company or service operated or provided by a permit holder all trade names are subject to approval by the vehicle for hire administrator as a condition to the issuance of the permit nontaxicab permit holders may contract with each other or other dispatch services under a collective trade name provided the permit holder informs the vehicle for hire administrator in writing of the use of the collective trade name b every taxicab permit holder shall 1 display a uniform and distinct color scheme on all vehicles all color schemes shall be subject to approval by the vehicle for hire administrator 2 have conspicuously and permanently affixed on such vehicle on each side of the vehicle and in letters not less than four inches in height  3 be painted with the uniform color scheme  4 conspicuously and permanently display a company vehicle number on the front and rear bumpers and on each side of the outside of the vehicle in figures two to three inches in height and in the color approved by the vehicle for hire administrator  and 5 be equipped with a permanently installed roof mounted device commonly known as a top light which shall be illuminated whenever the meter is on or when headlights andor parking lights are illuminated c every shuttle permit holder shall 1 have conspicuously and permanently affixed on each vehicle on each side of the vehicle and in letters not less than six inches in height the trade name approved  2 conspicuously and permanently display a company vehicle number on the front and rear bumpers and on both sides of the outside of the vehicle in figures two to three inches in height and in a color approved by the vehicle for hire administrator  3 not place any type or form of light device or other device on the roof commonly known as a top light or top hat whether or not permanently or temporarily affixed to the vehicle  4 not have any light device within the possession of the interior of the vehicle except for the area exclusively limited to the storage of baggage behind the rearmost seat  and 5 not have the words or a sign with the words taxicab taxi cab limousine limo luxury sedan or luxury or form thereof placed or affixed permanently or temporarily on any portion of the outside vehicle or anywhere within the interior of the vehicle except in the area exclusively limited to the storage of baggage behind the rearmost seat d every limousine permit holder shall 1 display the trade name or the approved collective trade name on the front license plate of the vehicle and the approved city vehicle number shall be on the front and rear bumpers of the vehicle in figures two to three inches in height and in the color approved by the vehicle for hire administrator  2 not be painted the uniform color or design scheme of any permitted taxicab vehicle for hire  3 not have the words or a sign with the words taxicab taxi cab shuttle or shuttle service or any form or translation thereof placed or affixed permanently or temporarily on any window or portion of the outside vehicle or anywhere within the interior of the vehicle excluding the trunk  7505 advertisement regulations a every taxicab permit holder shall obtain at first opportunity and thereafter continue to maintain for the duration of the taxicab permit a listing in the taxicab section of the yellow pages of each telephone book distributed to a substantial majority of the residents and businesses within the city the listing shall include the trade name approved for the taxicab permit holder and phone numbers where the public can reach the taxicab permit holders dispatch in order to obtain taxicab service b a nontaxicab permit holder may advertise but is not required to do so c it is prohibited and unlawful for a taxicab permit holder to advertise or allow or cause to be advertised in any telephone directory newspaper brochure bulletin flyer radio or television commercial or hotel leaflet an advertisement or solicitation for business which includes the words shuttle service limousine limo or shuttle or customluxury van van or any form of these words d it is prohibited and unlawful for a limousine vehicle permit holder to advertise or allow or cause to be advertised in any telephone directory newspaper brochure bulletin flyer radio or television commercial or hotel leaflet an advertisement or solicitation for business which includes the words shuttle service taxicab taxi cab luxury sedan shuttle or customluxury van or any form of these words e it is prohibited and unlawful for a shuttle service permit holder to advertise or allow or cause to be advertised in any telephone directory newspaper brochure bulletin flyer radio or television commercial or hotel leaflet an advertisement or solicitation for business which includes the words taxicab taxi cab limousine limo luxury sedan or any form of these words f a permit holder who has been issued permits for multiple categories may use in one advertisement the terms for each particular category of permit issued to the permit holder g if the permit holder operates outside the city limits a category of vehicle for hire service for which no permit has been issued by the city then the permit holder shall segregate the advertisement of the services into two separate advertisements one for city service and one for noncity service in the noncity advertisement the vehicle permit holder shall not use or allow the use of the word palm coast in the advertisement for the vehicle for hire service operated outside the city  7505 driver standards a every permit holder shall require and ensure that every driver under its control or using its vehicles 1 is hygienically clean with hisher body wellgroomed neat odor free and clean in appearance and the clothing clean and odor free  2 if a beard or mustache is worn ensure that it is wellgroomed and neatly trimmed at all times  3 wear trousers or females may wear skirts or dresses providing that the hem is not more than two inches above the top of the knee joint and is not strapless or halter type a shirt with a collar and sleeves shoes and socks and appropriate outer garments and shall not wear tshirts underwear worn as outer garments tank tops body shirts swim wear jogging or bathing shorts sweat suits work out clothing trunks or suits or similar types of attire or outer garments or footwear that is frayed ragged holed or open except that females may wear open toe footwear providing that such footwear is highheeled and is not clogs thongs shower shoes or sandals  7505 vehicles for hire rates and fares a all rates and surcharges imposed herein shall be adopted by resolution of the city council a meeting for the purpose of adopting the resolution shall be advertised ten days in advance in the local newspaper and the existing and proposed rates andor surcharges shall be published in the advertisement in the resolution the city council shall set an effective date for the new rates andor surcharges b in establishing any rate or surcharge the city council shall be guided by the following criteria 1 the rates or surcharges established by other governments and in other similarly situated metropolitan areas across the nation  2 the consumer price index for the transportation expenses for the past year  3 historical data relating to the revenue generated by vehicle permit holders in the city  4 information provided by the american automobile association or other similar local regional or national transportation information source  5 the expenses and income of vehicle permit holders  and 6 the expenses and income of drivers if available c the vehicle for hire administrator shall have the right to examine all books and records of all permit holders and drivers d any such rate or surcharge imposed required or collected by any permit holder or driver shall be in strict conformance with the adopted rates andor surcharges e the rates andor any surcharges adopted by the city council shall be posted by the vehicle for hire administrator and provided to each permit holder f printed schedules of the current applicable rates andor surcharges shall be available at all times for inspection in all vehicles for hire within each taxicab the schedule of the current adopted rates andor surcharges adopted by city council shall be permanently posted in a place with a view to the general public within the interior and on each doorside of the outside of the taxicab in addition if the city council adopts any rate or surcharge charge for the particular category of vehicle for hire then the vehicle permit holder shall post a sign or decal at least two inches by three inches at a location to be determined and approved by the vehicle for hire administrator in the interior exterior or window of the vehicle which states g it shall be the duty of the vehicle for hire permit holder to post the following signs within the interior of every vehicle for hire 1 a commentcomplaint sign on the lower left corner of the right rear door window which states if any comments or complaints call the city of palm coast at 386 9863700 the city permit number of shall be at least two by three inches and approved by the vehicle for hire administrator  and 2 the rate andor surcharge sign h every permit holder shall place on file with the vehicle for hire administrator the most current rates for its vehicle for hire service i any rate or surcharge imposed required or collected by any permit holder or driver shall be in conformance to the rate or surcharge established by the city council j it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to charge or attempt to charge any passenger a greater rate of fare than that which is currently allowed k it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to accept or receive any money or other gratuity including money commonly referred to as turkey money from any hotel motel restaurant or other business in consideration for diverting or attempting to divert a passenger from a business establishment to another business establishment l it is prohibited and unlawful for a taxicab driver to operate a taxicab unless a taximeter is used to determine the fare to be charged the taximeter must be a meter approved by the city to be used in the specific taxicab in which it is being used it is prohibited and unlawful to operate a taxicab with a taximeter that has not been approved by the city for that specific taxicab it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to operate a taxicab in which the driver knows the taximeter in the taxicab is not accurate m for a destination that is outside the city limits the driver shall provide each passenger with a flat rate prior to transport the rate must be agreed upon between the driver and the passenger before the trip begins the agreement may include with regard to taxicabs running the taximeter the entire trip as opposed to a flat rate the taximeter must be in activation while inside the city limits in the event the passengers decides to terminate the trip before leaving the city n a driver may refuse any trip to a destination outside the city limits permit holders are encouraged to establish uniform rates to area airports and cities to make these rates available to their dispatchers  7505 trip reportsrecords a the permit holder shall require that every driver will keep a trip report which shall show the following minimum information for each trip 1 the name of permit holder  2 the company unit number of the vehicle  3 the name of the driver  4 the date and time of trip origin  5 the origin and destination of the trip  6 the fare charged or the voucher number for the trip  and 7 the number of passengers transported on the trip b each trip report shall be consecutively numbered and shall be recorded on a form approved by the vehicle for hire administrator c each driver shall on a daily basis submit said trip reports to the permit holder who shall keep them for a period of at least 90 days the trip reports shall be submitted daily except drivers who lease the vehicle from the permit holder for a period longer than one day may submit the trip reports at the end of the lease period or weekly whichever is shorter d all trip reports shall be at all times open to inspection by the vehicle for hire administrator or inspectors and shall be produced on demand the trip reports shall be kept at the business office of the permit holder e if the permit holder uses dispatchers the permit holder shall make a record of each call received the time it is received the point of origin the time the request for service is dispatched the time of pickup and the destination if indicated by the prospective passenger such record shall be kept in the dispatch office for a minimum period of 90 days f each taxicab permit holder shall maintain records detailing the following information for a period of no less than two years 1 the total number of taxicab trips originating from an airport  2 the total number of taxicab service requests dispatched  3 the total number of taxicab trips made by all taxicabs excluding those taxicab trips originating at an airport  4 the total number of pickups that are over 20 minutes from the time dispatched  5 the total revenues generated for all taxicab metered miles for all taxicabs excluding those metered miles that originated from an airport  6 the total revenues generated for all taxicab metered miles for all citypermitted taxicabs originating from an airport  and 7 the total taxicab metered miles driven for all taxicabs excluding those originating at an airport  and 8 the total taxicab metered miles driven for all taxicabs originating from an airport  and 9 the total vehicle miles driven for all taxicabs  and 10 the average taxicab lease rate for a taxicab for one 24hour period  7505 conduct of drivers a a driver shall use the most direct available route on all trips unless the passenger specifically requests to change the route a driver shall be able to provide a reasonable and prudent amount of change and if correct change is not available no additional charge will be made to the passenger in attempting to secure the change if demanded by the passenger the driver shall deliver to the person paying for the hiring of the same at the time of such payment a receipt therefore in legible writing containing the trade name of the permit holder the company number and the drivers name showing upon such receipt all items for which a charge is made the total amount paid and the date of payment b a driver who occupies a taxicab stand shall occupy it at the end of the line and move into the first out position on the stand in orderly single file once obtaining the first out or loading position he or she shall accept the first request for transportation except that a driver shall not be obligated to accept trips terminating beyond the city limits such taxicab stands shall be for exclusive use by city permitted taxicabs the parking on such taxicab stands by a vehicle that is not a city permitted taxicab shall be prima facie evidence of a violation c each driver shall keep a trip report as required by this article each driver shall on a daily basis submit said trip reports to the permit holder except for drivers who lease the vehicles from the permit holder for a period longer than one day may submit the trip reports at the end of the lease period or weekly whichever is shorter all trip reports shall be at all times open to inspection by the vehicle for hire administrator d it is prohibited and unlawful for any person without being authorized by the city or without having made a prior agreement to provide vehicle for hire services to a specific patron offers to engage in any business trade or commercial transaction involving the rendering to another person of any vehicle for hire services unlawful solicitation occurs when a driver solicits passengers 1 from a location other than the drivers compartment or the immediate vicinity of his or her vehicle for hire  2 in a way that annoys or obstructs the movement of a person or follows any person for the purpose of unlawful soliciting  3 in a loud boisterous or annoying manner of voice or by sign or in any other annoying manner  or 4 by paying an employee of another business to solicit passengers for or give preferential treatment in directing passengers to the drivers vehicles for hire e it is prohibited and unlawful for a person to solicit vehicle for hire services at any local airport hotel motel bed and breakfast restaurant retail or wholesale facility government facility or center any entertainment facility or center transportation facility or center or any other location of public gathering f it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to use obscene or profane language or to be abusive to passengers  7505 permit holder general responsibilities a a permit holder shall maintain on file for inspection by the city the names of all employees drivers their addresses telephone numbers and driver license numbers a permit holder shall maintain a file of all complaints received for inspection by the city permit holders are responsible for the actions of their employees when onduty b a permit holder is responsible for the conduct of its drivers the permit holder is also responsible for the condition of all of its vehicles and equipment operated as vehicles for hire actions of drivers or employees in violation of this article shall be imputed to the permit holder whose responsibility it shall be to ensure compliance c all permit holders shall maintain a place of business within the city limits from which they conduct their operations and shall comply with applicable provisions of the citys land development  7505 general prohibitions relative to drivers a it is prohibited and unlawful for any person to operate or cause to be operated or drive with the intent to pick up passengers originate oneway transportation or provide return service for noncontinuous transportation within the jurisdictional limits or upon the public streets of the city without a permit issued pursuant to this article b it is prohibited and unlawful for any permit holder or any person to operate cause to be operated allow to be operated or drive a vehicle for hire in or upon any street unless and until such person driving the vehicle shall have first obtained a drivers permit c it is prohibited and unlawful for the permit holder or driver to permit any person to accompany or use such vehicle for or to direct take or transport any other person with knowledge or reasonable cause to believe that the purpose of such directing taking or transporting is to accomplish a criminal activity d it is prohibited and unlawful for any person to reproduce alter manufacture use display or otherwise employ any facsimile or reproduction of the permits provided for in this article e it is prohibited and unlawful for a hotel motel or restaurant their agents or employees or any skycaps or bellmen to offer or pay any money or other gratuity including money commonly referred to as turkey money to a permit holder or a driver as consideration for diverting or attempting to divert a passenger or passengers from one hotel motel or restaurant to another hotel motel or restaurant or from a particular vehicle classification to another f it is prohibited and unlawful for a hotel motel or restaurant their agents or employees or skycaps or bellmen to receive or accept any money or other gratuity including money commonly referred to as turkey money from a permit holder or driver as consideration for diverting or attempting to divert a passenger or passengers from a transportation company or particular classification of vehicle for hire to another permit holder company driver or other classification of vehicle for hire service g whenever any taxicab is occupied by a passenger or passengers the driver shall not permit any other person to occupy or ride in such taxicab if the original passenger or passengers object thereto if a child under 14 years of age is the original passenger no other passenger shall be permitted in such taxicab without the consent of the parent or guardian of the original passenger h it is prohibited and unlawful for any person to solicit patronage for a vehicle for hire in a loud or annoying tone of voice or by any sign or in any manner to annoy any person or to obstruct the movement of any person it is prohibited and unlawful for a person to follow or touch another person or the luggage or belongings of another person for the purpose of soliciting service without the consent of that other person i it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to refuse or neglect to transport any orderly person upon request unless the vehicle for hire is already engaged or forbidden by the provisions of this article nothing herein shall prohibit the requirement of prepayment or deposit by a driver from a passenger j all drivers shall comply with all reasonable and lawful requests of any passenger as to the speed of travel and the route to be taken k it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to continue on duty for more than 12 hours of active driving time or more than 16 hours of onduty time during any 24hour period each driver shall record the time of commencing active duty and the times of ending active duty on the driver manifest l it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to use cigarettes or cigars while transporting a passenger the use of tobacco products by a driver is prohibited and unlawful by any passengers while in a vehicle for hire if so ordered by the driver m every driver shall thoroughly search the interior of each vehicle for hire at the termination of each trip for any article of value that may be left in the vehicle for hire by a passenger an article found in a vehicle for hire shall immediately be returned the passenger who left the article if the owner of the article is not known or unable to be located the driver shall deposit the article with the permit holder at the end of the drivers tour of duty the permit holder shall file a written notice with the city within 24 hours describing the article date and time of loss and the origin and destination of the trip of the passenger who lost the article n when requested by a passenger every driver shall give a legible receipt showing the permit holders name the drivers name the vehicle number and any item for which a charge was made the receipt shall also include that total amount paid and the date of such payment o it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver or any other person to solicit passengers for a vehicle for hire except when sitting in the drivers seat of the vehicle for hire or while standing within five feet of the vehicle for hire p it is prohibited and unlawful for the driver of a vehicle for hire to receive or discharge a passenger while impeding the flow of vehicular or pedestrian traffic drivers shall receive and discharge passengers in appropriate taxicab stands loading zones and curbsides out of the flow of traffic drivers shall discourage passengers from entering and exiting vehicle for hire while stopped at traffic signals and in travel lanes and shall be responsible for any and all occurrences relating to such stops q drivers may communicate with dispatchers and a potential passengers by portable telephone communication however a driver shall not pick up or transport any passenger without first notifying his or her dispatcher of the trip and recording the trip as required by this article single unit drivers are not required to notice a dispatcher but are required to record the trip r it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to operate a vehicle for hire whether on duty or off duty with any alcoholic beverage whether opened or unopened in the passenger compartment of the vehicle for hire the provisions of this article do not prohibit the possession of an alcoholic beverage in the possession of a bona fide passenger it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to allow a passenger to violate city or state laws regarding alcoholic beverages while in their vehicle for hires s it is prohibited and unlawful for a driver to permit more persons to be transported in a vehicle for hire at any one time than the seating capacity of such vehicle allows as established by the vehicle manufacturer  7505 suspension or revocation of permits a whenever there is reasonable cause to believe that a permit holder or driver is violating or has violated the provisions of this article the vehicle for hire administrator may initiate enforcement proceedings the permit holder or driver shall be advised in writing of the date time and place of a hearing on the matter mailed to the address on file with the vehicle for hire administrator no later than 15 days prior to the date of the hearing failure to appear shall result in an automatic suspension or revocation of the permit and may be grounds for revocation of said permits the vehicle for hire administrator shall conduct the hearing b as may be permitted by controlling state or federal law any citation issued for a violation may result in the immediate removal and impoundment of the vehicle by the city the vehicle shall be released to the owner upon payment of any tow storage inspection costs and any other fines or penalties c the vehicle for hire administrator may temporarily suspend any permitted vehicle for hire upon finding that a vehicle is unsafe or the observation of a patent defect of the vehicle for the transportation of the traveling public the suspension shall take effect immediately upon notice to the driver by issuance of a notice of suspension the vehicle for hire administrator shall affix a decal to both doorsides of the vehicle which states that the vehicle is suspended pending further investigation and correction of safety andor equipment violations and that the vehicle shall not transport any person for hire the decal shall remain affixed to the vehicle until either the permit holder corrects the safety andor equipment violations and has the vehicle inspected by the city and pays the reinstatement fee or successfully appeals the determination to the city manager the operation of a suspended vehicle or the unauthorized removal or alteration of the decals affixed to the vehicle shall result in revocation of the vehicle permit d the following shall constitute grounds for suspension of a vehicle for hire permit 1 if a permit holder operates allows leases or causes to be operated any vehicle for hire which has been issued a vehicle permit without said vehicle permit affixed to the motor vehicle  2 if a permit holder charges receives or obtains any fare from a passenger that is not strictly consistent with any rates and surcharges approved by the vehicle for hire administrator  3 if a permit holder charges receives or obtains any fare from a passenger that is not consistent with approved rates  4 if a permit holder gives leases or borrows to the driver or installs or equips in the interior of the vehicle any electrical device such as radar detectorfuzz buster police twoway or similar scanners or twoway radio frequency monitors  5 if a permit holder fails to have provided in the vehicle for hire a printed schedule of the current adopted rates andor surcharges available at all times for inspection in all vehicles for hire  6 if a permit holder fails to keep and file the applicable trip reports  7 if a permit holder tampers with or changes the adjustment of a meter  8 if a permit holder operates leases or causes to operate a taxicab with the knowledge that the meter does not accurately register the mileage and the approved rate evidence of the breaking of an official meter seal of the florida department of agriculture and consumer services shall constitute prima facie evidence that a meter does not accurately register the mileage and rate  9 if a permit holder fails to equip and maintain every vehicle for hire with an operational twoway radio or comparable communication devices such that office dispatchers may immediately and effectively notify drivers of requests for service and such that drivers may immediately and effectively request assistance should assistance be needed  10 if a permit holder has in its possession at its place of business dispatch operation or in any building or vehicle under its control and possession any device used for the monitoring of a competitors radio frequency  11 if a permit holder fails to have permanently posted in a place with a view to the general public within the interior and on each doorside of the outside of each vehicle for hire the schedule of the current adopted rates charges andor surcharges  12 if a permit holder operates leases or causes to be operated a vehicle for hire that does not comply with any of the safety and equipment standards  13 if the city council adopts any rate or surcharge for the particular category of vehicle for hire and a permit holder fails to post the informational sign or decal  14 if a permit holder operates leases or causes to operate a vehicle for hire under a trade name color scheme or logo not approved  15 if a permit holder offers or pays any money or other gratuity including money commonly referred to as turkey money to a hotel motel or restaurant their agents or employees or skycaps or bellmen as consideration for diverting or attempting to divert a passenger or passengers from a classification of vehicle for hire transportation company permit holder or drivers to its company or drivers  16 if a permit holder receives or accepts any money or other gratuity including money commonly referred to as turkey money from a hotel motel or restaurant their agents or employees or skycaps or bellmen as consideration for diverting or attempting to divert a passenger or passengers from a hotel motel or restaurant to another hotel motel or restaurant  17 if a permit holder intentionally or knowingly misleads by any act or word a passenger or potential passenger about a the time or place of arrival or departure of a train airplane any vehicle for hire or bus  b the location of any building or place or the distance between two points  c the cost or amount of the trip  or d information on the cost availability or quality of another permit holder or driver  18 if a permit holder operates or causes to be operated a permitted vehicle for hire in a nonpermitted classification  19 if a permit holder fails to require and enforce the driver dress code  20 if a permit holder provides leases gives borrows or uses a taxicab top light sign or other roof device in a nontaxicab vehicle for hire  21 if a permit holder fails to supply the city with a current automobile
